Drill crew was in the process of making surface checks on a test tool. The test tool was rigged up
Hurricane Lili caused the complete loss of an 8 legged offshore platform. no pollution or injuries.
Overpressure of a regeneration fuel gas fired furnace resulting in 1 LWC and damage to the furnace.
Personnel were carrying out preventive maintenance on platform1 and platrom2 LCR CO2 gaseous system
While disembarking passengers from the helicopter, the aircraft moved forward and veered starboard.
A pickup overturned by being driven at high speed.  In this event a worker died by cranial fracture.

A fire broke out on board a truck transferring cargo. There were no injuries but the cargo was lost.
A Powerwell Hydro-cyclones unit installed as temporary equipment to remove fines /sand from the 36•À_•À_
During lifting of some drilling equipment a roughneck crushed his leg between catwalk and hand rail.

A patrol vehicle was attacked by armed robbers. The deceased was shot in the head and died instantly.
An accidental explosion occured at a pump station during a tie-in in the upgrade of the pump station.
Changing landing lights on helicopter landing deck and fell approx 30 feet to the flare bridge below.
Contractor returned to the houseboat in an intoxicated condition and fell into the river and drowned.
2 scaffolders were dismantling an overboard scaffold that had been constructed to remove the lifeboat
A construction worker slipped and fell through a grating opening onto a steel plate 1.5 metres below.
A person was hit in his back when a load being lifted by deck crane suddenly lowered out of control.
HIPO, X-mas Tree Damage (Fall of Lubricator & BOP Assembly on Xmas Tree During Lifting Operation)
Tripping of a platform due to dropping of communication with DCS, while loading the new DCS software.
Vessel boarded by pirates who took personal belongings of crew and disembarked after approx. 30 mins.
A labourer injured his left thumb while working with electrical cables. He was given 14 days off work.
A vessel collided with a mobile rig. The vessel was occupied with unloading when the incident happened
Two mechanics were burned while removing a valve on a pipe system that was not properly depressurised.
Whilst offloading a pipe carrying barge a contractor was hit on the head by a pipe.  He died instantly.
A large gas cloud of vaporised hydrocarbon and residuum covered the product pump skid at the Refinery.
Contractor hospitalised for surgery to amputate two toes caused by a pipe rolling off a truck onto him.
Gas released from 3•À_•À_ flowline of auto-choke valve at the wellhead platform. This is Tier 1 IRHV event.
One of the penetrators on the ROV GPS locator unit was damaged and it was decided it should be changed.
A contractor slipped from the top of a truck along with part of the truck load which fell on top of him.
Contractor fell whilst climbing onto a moving crane, fracturing his leg.  Died later of blood poisoning.
Contractor security guard was found unconscious and severely beaten.  He died later from his injuries.
Fork lift driver was lifting and moving 6" pipe line.  Suddenly the pipe sprung back and hit the driver.
A Contractor employee received electric shock and suffered hand burns whilst working in the Sub-station.
Bails failure offshore where they dropped from the derrick to the rig floor. No one was hurt or injured.
Vehicle hit a motorcyclist then swerved into a group of bystanders.  1 fatality and injuries to 4 others.

A night shift driller's left middle finger was crushed by a door. He had been trying to close it quietly.
A panel operator recieved four alarms from the flare mornitoring system and found the LP flare flame out.

During trouble shooting on gas compressor A to find an internal leakage an unwanted gas leakage occurred.
Falling Ice in the battery limit of train2, air leak occurred. Minor damage occurred in pipes insulation.
He was working with  2 7/8" drilling pipe when he was struck in the mouth. A piece of his tooth fell out.
High pressured frac stack near miss. Relief valve went off and pump was shut down. Pressure was bled off.
Caught by a sudden wave, washing him over the side. Drowned despite wearing protective suit and life vest.
Chain saw operator sustained compound fractures to right let.  Hit by tree he had cut. Died from injuries.
Pick-up truck involved in collision in dust cloud.  Driver & one rear-seated passenger fataly wounded.
The zodiac was found attached at the supply, but the zodiacman was missing.  Searched for without success.
A water separator, weighing 6kg and 6.5 metres high, fell down. There was a person nearby (3 metres away).
A worker received serious injuries (several fractures) after his ladder collapsed due to poor positioning.
Leaky seal of Blow out preventer actuator in a coiled tubing was found during the blow out preventer test.

The decesed lost control of his Toyota pickup truck which then overturned. He died later from his injuries.

A contractor was struck by a filling hose coupling for an SCBA cylinder during recharging of the cyclinder.

Observed red status and a lot of exhaust just after a new stand was screwed together and slips were opened.
Patrol boat started to sink due to ingress of sea water in to the engine compartment during routine patrol.
While Replacing Micro Turbine Battery sells technician received partial thickness burn to his index finger.
A vehicle struck and killed a child on a public road who may have been trying to cross the road imprudently.
Security guard killed when unknown intruders entered wellhead site and set off explosive device on flowline.
The deceased's truck was hit from the rear by a third party and caught between the bus and a truck in front.
A contractor dislocated his shoulder when his jacket was caught by a rotating pipe in the threading machine.
A mobile crane overturned due to stabilisers not being fully extended even though the load was only 200 kg.
An aged tree fell over in company residential area, crushing a car from bonnet to boot.  No injury reported.
An instrument pipe cutter, weighing 386 grammes, fell down approximately 20 metres. 2 personnel were nearby.
During painting work the company employee lost his balance and touched the metal construction under voltage.
He used a high-pressure washer with water to removed paint/rust. The jet hit the operator on his right knee.
Severe damage to the structure and integrity of the system of pulleys and block drill traveller Petrex 5899.
While pulling a drill line into the drawworks to attach it to the deadman, the contractor sprained his back.
24" line under stress "whiplashed" during welding. Pipeline struck welder causing injuries to face and chest.
The decesed lost control of a truck they were driving whilst crossing a bridge and fell into the river below.

A blanking bull plug fell approximately 40 feet from the 9 5/8" liner hanger cementing head to the rig floor.

A worker slipped on the wet deck after descending a short stairway.  He went over on his ankle as he slipped.
Boiler B was being prepared for de-isolation after box-up. A report was then received that the fuel gas plugs
Subcontractor supply vehicle arrived to base camp after dark, and without a journey management plan in place.
The vehicle KRAZ, while removing the over-dimentioned load, demaged the power lines 6 kV. Power was cut off.
While working with tubing on the pipe deck a pipe fell and hit a person in the back. He was sent to hospital.
The driver of a truck lost control of the vehicle on a steep slope.  The vehicle crashed and two persons died.
A fire started in one of the porta-cabins near a warehouse due to an electrical extension cord malfunctioning.
Amputation of right thumb following lifting accident whilst establishing construction camp for drilling sites.
C2 deluge line re-displaced away from its concrete support, no impact on the system to react during emergency.
The fitter's thumb was crushed when he was installing the connecting rod to the piston of an auxiliary engine.
The injured person's eyes became inflamed from exposure to biocide chemical vapour when he opened a container.
A barge with six persons onoard overturned. Five of them escaped but the sixth drowned as he was in the galley.
A corroded square metal plate approx. 0.6 Kg weight fell approximately 18 meters from top of an overhead crane.
Lid on Corrosion Inhibitor tote tank not secured properly fell into the sea when lifting on board the platform.
A carpenter fell from a ladder onto a concrete floor.  He died due to excessive bleeding from a cut to the head.
One third party died and 2 others were injured when their truck was in a head-on collision with a company truck.
Two trucks collided when one of the trucks was trying to avoid an oncoming car which was overtaking at the time.
Worker slipped and fell, bangning his head on a log.  He was transported to hospital but died the following day.
Workplace violence. Boat driver was shot as he was trying to prevent outboard engine and boat from being stolen.
A helicopter crash landed at a village near to Moro Airport. The pilot was the only person onboard. No injuries.
Employee was attempting to adjust air conditioning/heating unit while standing on bench and fell injuring wrist.
The victims, 2 persons, were injured when the vehicle they were travelling in skidded and collided with a truck.
9 persons were killed when a helicopter that was transporting them from offshore facilities crashed into the sea.
N/A
While cutting a 12inch diameter pipe on the bottom of a lake a diver was struck by a sudden movement of the pipe.
A roustabout slipped and lost his balance while getting down from the mud pump. This resulted in a fractured arm.
Boil off gas at LNG Plant was cold vented from the tank flare system due to flare being temporarily extinguished.
Contractor was hit in head with chicksan and union that fell from above, fracturing skull which required surgery.
During the safety instruction training for working on a device for rescuing from heights a  near miss took place
Mulitiple instances of dropped drillpipe and drill collars from pipe handling equipment on a new build drillship.
One of three objects being lifted fell down due to insufficient securing. Potential for serious personnel injury.
Operator suffered hand laceration from a cooling fan as the plant unit was started up. He required five stitches.
Passenger in locally hired water tanker fell from vehicle sustaining fracture and crush injuries to hand and arm.
A Toyota ran off the road in poor weather conditions and crashed into a tree. The front two occupants were killed.
Group of contractors were travelling to the site by canoe, when they were shot at, injuring 4 people, one fatally.
A contract operations technician slipped from a fixed ladder, falling 2-3 metres.  He sustained a fractured wrist.
Slop oil pump upstream flange failed through loosening of its studs resulting in a release of hydrocarbon vapours.
The end plate of a pneumatic actuator was blown off due to over-pressurisation. The projectile struck an operator.

Trailer carrying a crane overturned causing the crane boom to fall onto to the trailer cab and crushing the driver.
While removing the drilling pipe from 4000ft. the well foundation failed causing the drilling platform to overturn.

Whilst offloading a truck, the crane boom rotated and crushed the victim's head between the boom and another crate.
A car carrying two people rolled over after pulling off the road to give way to an oncoming truck that was weaving.
A contractor was hospitalised for surgery due to injury to his spine when he was hit on the neck by a falling tree.
A driver returning to camp along mountain road lost control on a wide corner resulting in the vehicle rolling over.
A truck and trailer fell into the river when the ramp restraining chains failed as it was reversing off the ferry.
During RIH activity (6000 ft MD) the drilling line cut. The travelling block fell on the rotary table. No injuries.

A person climbed up to do some work 10 metres above deck without any safety measures. Potential for 10 metre  fall.

Lifting incident.  Attachment slipped off fork lift truck forks and struck employee in storage area of gas terminal.

While lifting drilling pipes using a forklift, a worker was struck by one pipe which slipped and hit him on the head.
A worker sprained ligaments in his wrist. When back onshore he went to the Hospital and was signed off for two weeks.
Assistant driller suffered severe head injuries when he was hit by a drill-collar lifted into the V-door of the rig.
During a revision stop there was a gas leak from the processing plant. The situation was normalized after 30 minutes.
Employee was closing a valve with wrench and cheater pipe when wrench slipped, causing cheater to hit employee's leg.
Driver lost control of vehicle, it left the road and rolled over in a ditch, fatally injuring the driver and his mate.
A contractor suffered a serious head injury when he was struck by a steel shuttering plate during cellar construction.
A minor fire happened in one of the sockets when public electricity was cut off and diesel generator started working.
An engine backfire ignited gas in the area. The injured person suffered 2nd and 3rd degree burns over 25% of his body.
Blind flange was installed at the wrong place U/S of STC-7001 instead of D/S of STC-7001 (against P&ID in SD W/P).
Stomach illness (bleeding ulcer) in expat drilling contractor in Angola resulting in medical evacuate to Johannesburg.

Driver lost control of his pick-up truck and collided with a 48" pipe joint.  Front seat passenger was fatally injured.
The driver of a ready-mix concrete truck lost control on a slippery slope.  4 workers jumped out, 1 of whom was killed.
Victim hit by car whilst crossing road at unauthorised point.  Was in intensive care until 12 March 1998, when she died
While working to free heavy drill pipe at the top of the derrick the victim was crushed between the drillpipe and tool.
A forklift collided with an overhead condensate pipe causing the pipe to deflect by 1m.  No hydrocarbons were released.
A mechanical fitter cut his arm with a grinder while working on the flow line. His injury required 6 external stitches.

A small skiff rammed a patrol boat. The skiff slowly sank and the two intruders were rescued and sent to the Navy Camp.
Gas leakage from return mud set off 2 gas detectors in the shaker room. The personnel mustering went according to plan.
While working with the shaker - the person fell down on the deck. His left hand was broken and he was sent to hospital.
A supervisor was killed while driving a pick-up truck and crashing against a vehicle coming from the opposite direction.
Pipe stack was being moved from a truck using a crane.  The load turned over catching the supervisor who was underneath.
Fire in the main galley. Oil in deep fryer auto ignited, fire was controlled quickly no injuries or damage to equipment.
Mechanic's finger-tip was caught between the engine V-belt and alternator pulley wheel when another turned the ignition.
One employee discovered, during normal maintaince work, that the outer ring gasket of the sour gas pipeline was broken.
Smoke detection during Man Overboard training stopped the operation. The MOB needed assistance from the stand by vessel.
There was some boiling down of gas during the flushing of the produced water tank. The caused 2 gas detectors to go off.

During seismographic operation and conducting a diamond drill, a labourer died when this tool contacted an electric cable
In a bend, truck driver lost control of vehicle which overturned off the road.  The cause of the accident was high speed.

During embarkation a of tugboat at the pier, it accidentally ran into the platform causing partial damage to the tugboat.
IP sustained leg injuries when the Top Drive System frame retracted as he operated valves while sitting within the frame.
Member of cleaning staff dropped corrosive cleaning product used for showers and contents came in contact with their eye.
Under completion an increase was observed in the volume of well fluid. The well was shut down and gas was circulated out.

A pole from a winch made contact with some high tension wiring as the victim was unloading and he died from electrocution.
Contractor complained of pain in leg, medical treatment was provided by doctor, patient died while in transit to hospital.
The victim sustained a fracture to the leg when offloading gas cylinders. He died in hospital due to excessive blood loss.
A contractor who was transferring from a crew boat to an offshore platform was hit on the face (nose) by a swinging rope.
A fluorescent lamp ballast wiring contact overheated and burnt out, caused activation of the audible alarm at warehouse B.

Rigging failed, releasing a balance weight that fell 2m striking worker on the side of the head knocking him to the floor.

Cracked stone was being transported in a shovel when the driver took a violent turn and turned over and trapped the driver.

A 1.54 metre long bumber sub, weighing 200 kg, fell 6 metres from the catwalk to the pipe deck.  No personnel were injured.
A pipe fell from the topdrive to the rig floor, height : 29 meter;  length: 0,5 m;  weight: 50 kg. 3 personnel were nearby.
A supply vessel crew member fractured his ankle when struck by the basket during backloading from an offshore drilling rig.
Boat engine compartment flooded with sea water while manoeuvring. Boat was rescued and no major consequences were reported.
Company ambulance proceeded to Jetty head for medical assistance. The Site Standing Instruction (SSI) was not fully applied
The field ambulance rolled over about 600 metres from the rig location on itsway from the rig site to the new rig location.
The deceased's vehicle lost traction at a bend and subsequently rolled over. The rollover bar broke and the cab was crushed.
The operative was dismantling a walkway. This had been modified in a manner unknown by the operative. The walkway collapsed.
While jetting the legs in preparation for rig move jetting system ruptured fatally pushing operator into adjacent equipment.
2 gas detecors detected 20-30% LEL in modul M04. Automatic shutdown in production. All personnel mustered according to plan.
A lighting lamp fixture cover fell down from the lighting pole located on the road near the entrance to the refrigerant area
Seaman sustained a mild crush injury to his hand when it became caught in a bight of rope during a tanker mooring operation.
Unsafe Explosive Remnants of War (ERW) practices coupled with a recent ERW group audit that did not identify these practices
The victim , an engineer, injured his face when the hot steam from the car radiator burst out when he was opening the bonnet.
A barge used for the transportation of equipment and drilling equipment sunk into Lake Maracaibo and four workers were killed.
A drilling floor hand was struck by a chicksan swivel assembly and circulating hose, after the assembly fell from the derrick.
Checking an under water pipeline in the Maracaibo Lake, a diver died by immersion due to a violation of the safety procedures.
The deceased was driving an articulated truck. The truck overturned on a straight stretch of road. No other vehicles involved.
During pipeline mantenance operations inside a trench, two operators became caught due to soil slipping from one of the walls.
The washout exposed the gas pipeline and created an unsupported span of 51-meters where san supporting the pipeline was eroded
2 guard were bound and gagged by intruders. 1 guard survived the attack but the other guard died as a reesult of strangulation.
Co-pilot was shot by guerrillas and fatally injured, whilst helicopter was in service.  The crew landed the helicopter safely.
A diving support vessel carried out diving and ROV operations within the 500M Zone of the platform without a BA cascade system.
A water tanker overturned and rolled during delivery to secondary base camp for seismic activities.  The driver escaped unhurt.
Contractor employees were connecting 10 inch pipes. When they lifted up one piece of pipe, a helper's left finger was crushed.
Employee suffered loss of skin/tissue on fingers of right hand while attempting to remove solid sulfur between roller and belt.
One of the gas detectors was set off at 18.30, NAS 1. The area was checked out and was clear at 18.40. Production was shutdown.
Overhead crane electrical cable became seized while travelling causing damage to the cable which caused the crane to power off.
The employee opened a ball valve under pressure. The pressure turned the blowdown pipe and catapulted the employee onto a rack.
The injured person was using pipe tongs. He dropped the pipe tongs and hit his leg. The leg was broken. He was sent to hospital
A contractor pay-loader collided with a motorcycle carrying 3 adults and a baby. The motorcycle rider died due to head injuries.
The worker fell from the roof of the La Salina  Central Workshop when he was installing an antenna to receive computer signals
Well blew out through the rotary table and caught fire.  The man was working in the derrick and fell 10m on top of the doghouse.
2 gas detectors activated  in modul M10 main deck. Automatical shutdown in production. The personnel mustered according to plan.
A contractor crane driver, who was moving a crane to 3 meters' clearance of the edge of the excavated trench for a 48•À_•À_ pipeline
A deck operator got his foot stuck in the guide rope and was lifted 3-4 metres above the deck before the operation was stopped .
A hose with 250 bar was out of control. There were 2 personnel nearby and they could have been injured if the hose had hit them.
Contractor suffered injured ribs when struck by guardrail sprung from its sockets during launching of a Remote Operated Vehicle.
Garbage collecting truck rolled over about 22 km from the rig location on its way from the rig site to the waste treatment area.
The victim, a driver, was securing a load on a trailer when he slipped and caused the boom to hit his face and head. (LWD 1 day)
A Public Affairs representative on speedboat jumped ship when boat came under cross fire. He was not wearing a floatation device.
An explosion inside a gas turbine enclosure caused a door to open suddenly. The door struck the operator on the side of the head.
The deceased was standing on top of a wellside storage truck when the tank exploded killing him and seriously wounding one other.
While laying pipeline on a trench the crane wireline broke and the pipe struck the welder who at that time was inside the trench.
A fire occurred on a marine platform due to loss of control of an oilwell caused by gas outbreak during finishing of the oilwell.
Operators and contractors isolated and began draining the FWKO to enable repairs.  The vessel collapsed as it was being drained.
Test weight ( 4 ton) was transfered over doorstep. The test weight began to move and the wheel from the trolly ran over his foot.
The failure of a 12 inch pipeline and the oil spill of 570 Bls of 33.5 API crude oil was due to fabrication defects on the pipe.
Two objects, 0,3 and 0,5 kilogrammes respectively, fell down from the top of the derrick. Potential for serious personnel injury.
A torque wrench struck the deceased in the chest when the bolt at the end of the wrench was ejected under 5000 pounds of pressure.
Contractor security guard at camp was shot in the head by robbers, dying instantly.  Others in the camp were physically assaulted.
During drilling operations a pipe was being lifted by a winch when its book failed and killed a worker by hitting him on the head.
During installation of a conductor pipe, a hammer guide fell from the conductor driving equipment striking the victim on the head.
Not work related. Deceased dived overboard from offshore vessel to recover football - he was swept away by tide and not recovered.
Truck carrying drillpipe left public highway as a result of icy road conditions.  Vehicle overturned, resulting in driver's death.
Welder was struck in the head by a 20" pipeline, which was being moved by a crane during the construction of a crude-oil pipeline.
A contractor owned vehicle with 2 passengers traveling at approximately 40 km/hr experienced brake failure, no injuries or damage.
An aircraft was about to land when, at approx 2-3 meters above the ground, a large bird flew up and struck the aircraft nose cone.
As preparations were being made for a diver to enter the water, the port main engine of the dive boat was started without warning.
Catastrophic failure of the boom limit mechanism on the 100•À_ lattice boom on a Sea-King Crane. Structural collapse of crane boom.
Flare drum drain line level control valve stuck in open position , hence gas containing H2S was passing out from downstream line.
Injured party was exposed to well head pressure when opening a valve. The release resulted in fluid being injected under the skin.
The victim, a driver, injured himself in an accident when his vehicle rolled over. The injury kept him away from work for 12 days.
Whilst drilling a hole in a pipe, an elevator hinge weighing 7.7 kg came loose and fell to the floor, narrowly missing the worker.
Workers were carrying out a cleaning job of an underground water tank without taking any safety measures for confined space entry.
Victim was dismantling a copper object in his tent on the camp.  The object exploded, fataly wounding him and injuring a colleague.
A 58 cm pipe weighing 1000 gr fell 6 metres from scaffolding. There was a person nearby (2 meter away). The area was not roped off.
A contractor worker was refuelling a rig when he slipped and injured his knee and hip.  He was given four weeks until he recovered.
A scaffolding plank fell off of a crane boom on the pipedeck. The area was barriered off, but crane personnel were inside the area.
A truck collided with an overhead gas line supplying a village and ruptured it. There were no injuries and the leak was controlled.
During working with logging equipment the operator had to lift the MDT equipment. During lifting he get a sudden pain in this back.
The injured party was cleaning a vacuum pump when he accidently caught his finger in the pulley and cut his finger off. (LWD 1 day)
The victim had his elbow disconnected when he slipped and fell to the ground. He was stepping down from the Compactor. (LWD 7 days)
A company ferry was attacked by armed robbers. One of the 3 operators was shot dead the other 2 jumped overboard and swam to safety.
The deceased lost control of the truck whilst driving over a bridge. The vehicle went off the road and crashed into the river below.
A 2 ton chain block snapped when lifting a pipe spool.  One person required first aid treatment.  Potential for more serious injury.
A Fuel Truck delivering Jet A1 liquid fuel to the Site had an accident and the truck rolled over. Driver injured, not serious (CTR).
The legs of a jack-up drilling rig broke free of the seabed on jacking down. Minor damage was caused to the adjacent fixed platform.
Vehicle was driven into the rear of a stationary truck which was stranded in the middle of the road.  The driver was fatally wounded.
While a worker was unloading petroleum from a vacuum truck a fire occurred in the draining pond and the worker fell into it and died.
Fire in compressor casing on OSD. Mustering according to plan. Deluge released.Shut down in production. The fire was quickly put out.
One of the fabrication workshop roof light fell down on the ground in the working area while the fabrication team was working nearby.
A contract surveyor was killed when a third party truck collided with the contractor's vehicle.
A Super Puma helicopter crashed following mechanical failure in the power transmission system.  The aircraft disintegrated in the air.
The deceased encountered a robbery in progress and was killed instantly when one of the robbers opened fire on the deceased's vehicle.
A floorman's left middle finger was caught between a kelly and a hydraulic machine, when he was conducting a routine maintenance task.
A member of staff momentarily lost consciousness when cleaning a hazardous drains sump tank but was immediately removed by colleagues.
During the inspection of a sea water inlet to the fire pump, a diver who was to perform that job was injured. He was sent to hospital.
During the running of BOP and riser the lifting equipment was not fastened correctly. The driving equipment came loose from the riser.
They were working near by the door where the trolley stands. Another person open the door and he was crushed between door and trolley.
Station guard was found dead in condensate pit after being overcome by hydrocarbon fumes.  Being in the pit was not part of his duties.
A bolt (weight: 460 gram) fell down from the derrick and fell down at the setback area. Some people were working nearby, 2 metres away.
A hydrogen explosion and fire occurred in the vicinity of the compressor building. There were no injuries resulting from the explosion.
Accidental emission  of oil. There was a technical failure in the measurement system causing an accidential emission from closed drain.
The 6" gas export line from neighboring platform failed at riser section on production platform and discharged gas into the atmosphere.
Two gas detectors were triggered. The deluge was released and production shut down (NAS 2.2). The personnel mustered according to plan.
Upon take off there was a sudden loss of power from the helicopter. The helicopter settled to the ground with no damage to the machine.
Water leak occurred in the DA HVAC/Switchgear room during start-up of seawater pump following blackout.  Water sprayed over switchgear.
When they were lifting pipes from the pipe deck with a pipe handling crane, one of the pipes came loose . There was 2 personnel nearby.
A crane came into contact with an overhead powerline.  A contractor holding the guy line was severely burned and later died of injuries.
A worker was hit on the head and killed by a portable tank used for evaluation of sands in a production well, while it was being lifted.
Contractor was cutting down a tree to clear brush for laying seismic lines.  As tree fell it struck contractor in the chest and abdomen.
Employee was erecting a flare tower on a platform and fell approximately 100 ft. to the platform deck. Death was probably instantaneous.
The sailor disappeared in the Lake Maracaibo for unknown reasons. The contractor was building a gas platform when the accident happened.
A hammer head fell from the PA main deck on to the cellar deck whilst hammering to remove the hand rails for a crane boom tip inspection
A roughneck was standing on the scaffolding when his head was injured. During work the cable was free and the chain hit him in his face.
Alwyn area. During lifting operations, a process vessel fell into the sea. It was recovered without significant damage a few days after.
A truck fitted to transport personnel dropped down a ravine 30 metres whilst transporting site labourers.  One was killed and 16 injured.
A worker travelling in a vehicle heading to Unity Oil Field sustained severe head trauma and died instantly when the vehicle rolled over.
Actual occurrence unknown, no witnesses.  Fell from port beam of well slot (drilling rig).  Hit production platform side.  Fell into sea.
Victim was crushed between the handrail of the barge and the underside of the counterweight of a crawler crane as the crane slewed round.
A logging truck came close to a head on collision when the central road marking changed from dotted to solid as the road entered a curve.
An uncontrolled gas release. The rig was evacuated.  Gas vented to the atmosphere for 14 hours.  Potential for severe personnel injuries.
Rigger struck under the chin by wire rope (crane boom pendant) whilst working on 1.5 metre platform ladder. IP sustained fracture to jaw.
The derick barge anchor wire failed due to internal corrosion.  Risk of barge losing station when anchored close to production platforms.
While lifting a sub sea tree from a truck to the load spreader on the motor vessel the load shifted and moved downward two to three feet.
Whilst descending a ladder an employee slipped and fell 1.5-2 metres to process grating, landing on his right ankle. (Lost workday case).
On a supply during a maritime work the sailor alone is snatched on a capstan and dislocated by collisions with the structures of the boat.
A chopper landed close (300 m) to a block valve station while depressurization of the pipeline was ongoing, without any prior information.
A contractor was hospitalised for crushed hips/back when caught between sleeper and pipe. A sleeper had been stored on top of a pipe pile.
A traverser carriage (ca 100 kg) fell down 4 m during transfering of BOP on the Celler deck. A person who was standing on the BOP was hit.
During the planned lifting operation of an SPS unit a cover on the top of the unit weighing 10 kg fell 15 metres. No personnel was nearby.
High pressure washing was in progress due to paint program. There was a hole in the hose and the operator lost control. (Pressure 200 bar)
The driver lost control of his pick-up and rolled over. The vehicle came to rest on driver's side. The driver was injured and was treated.
The handrail of LNG loading platform hit by the loading arm-D during fast manoeuvring to parking position after completing its maintenance
Contractor was fatally injured when a block wall collapsed while he was attempting to remove an obsolete electrical adjacent to the wall.
During repair work of a protection structure of a gas pipe line, a worker was run over and killed by a 750 truck which ran off the highway.
The derrickman was struck by  hydraulic drill pipe tongs, when coming back to its resting position. The worker was in the path of the tool.
Third party drowned in a burrow pit left over from drilling operations. He reportedly went to bathe in the pit and was later found drowned.
While installing a two ton cooler, temporary housing was removed and the unit structure collapsed causing fatal injuries to one individual.
Whilst a truck was transporting 30 workers towards the top of a slope its engine stalled and the truck overturned and rolled several times.
Whilst the deceased was extinguishing a fire the top of a portable fire extinguisher was propelled into his abdomen causing fatal injuries.
A 2kg floating element came loose from the hose station and fell 1.5 metres.  The element hit a helmet - but there was no personnel injury.
A contract employee was electrocuted upon contact with a 6kV line while preparing to tie in power offtake, after ascending the wrong pylon.
A road accident occurred when the unit was turning left to enter the residence and another bus that was being driven too fast hit the unit.
A wire guide weighing 9 kilogrammes was hit, got loose, and fell 25 metres down to the drill floor. Potential for serious personnel injury.
Pressure testing up to 5000psi was carried out without a permit to work (PTW) in place.  The area for the pressure test was not barricaded.
The load capacity of the two 50 ton cranes was exceeded while conducting a simulated lift on the jetty of launching the cable layout boats.
A contractor burned his hand with steam from water being used to cool a recently welded pipe.  He received first aid for first degree burns.
A contractor's leg was fractured above the ankle requiring surgery and hospitalization.  He had been struck by a drill pipe during hoisting.
A piece of grating was displaced and fell down into the sea while pulling a faulty fibre optic cable box on gratings platform at Jetty Head.
Company vehicle travelling between sites hit pedestrian who stepped out between parked vehicles. Fractured leg and hospitalisation resulted.
Crash during final approach of dedicated aircraft. Two of the of seven passengers onboard were seriously injured including one third party.
During deanchoring of an accommodation barge, one of the anchor wires hooked a subsea pipeline flange and caused major subsea pipeline leak.
During operational test of pedestal crane found that 16 (out of 48) bolts were sheared in sequence from slew ring to pedestal (bottom half).
Near miss - No injuries - security vehicle was washed down stream while attempting to cross a lugger. Vehicle came to a stop against a tree.
Platform collapsed onto contractor who was lying underneath sheltering from the sun.  Platform collapsed due to weight of sand loaded onto it
Victim slipped into a swamp whilst marking the route for a dredger. It is thought the air trapped in his waders caused him to float inverted.
A labourer came near to the concrete machine and bent his body above the machine. His shirt was caught by the machine and injured his chest.
A worker was performing a task at a wellhead facility and was struck in the arm by the bonnet of an air/gas actuated valve, severing the arm.
An electrical supervisor sustained 3rd degree burns to 40% of his body due to a short circuit of the 6.6 KV spare cubicle he was inspecting.
The victim, a tire fitter, injured himself on the jaw when the ring blew off the rim of a tire he was repairing. He was given two weeks rest.
While rigging down the drilling rig, an employee received electrical burns to his face and arm due to contact with high voltage power supply.
Driver of water tanker lost control on a sharp bend causing the vehicle to turn over and crash into a field below.  The driver died on impact.
The deceased was returning to base when he lost control of the vehicle whilst avoiding a pot-hole. The vehicle somersaulted and he was killed.
A crane was lifting a container and the swell increased. The EXP cable drum struck the bottom of the container and damaged the cable and drum.
Marine •À__ Vehicle travelling between Fly Camp and Line Camp became stuck and had to overnight in the field. With loss of radio communications.
When working with boom wire he crushed his left foot between bracket and fastening to wire. The safety shoes were damaged - the shoe cracked.
Worker fell overboard during scaffolding rig down activity (12 metre drop to sea) and was rescued safely using rescue boat from nearby vessel.
Worker was struck by a valve that had sheared off the overdrive assembly while it was being lowered into position to latch into a joint liner.
Contractor was standing in front of a fork lift truck when the truck lurched forward.  Contractor was lacerated by the fork in the groin area.
A passenger received serious head injuries when the car he was travelling in sufferred tyre failure, left the road and struck a telegraph pole.
Contractor fell down a staircase and sprained his knee.  He was carrying a bucket of tools with both hands and so was not holding the handrail.
Four victims were burnt following a condensate spill in the river. The ignition was caused by one of the victims welding on a 36 inch pipeline.
Lift gear failure led to a dropped BOP, damage to equipment and a man overboard.  The circumstances leading up to this incident are as follows:
One of the Turbine blade rotated while maintenance activities were in progress. There was no one in the line of fire, hence nobody was injured.
The well was spraying oil from the flange between the well head and the tubing head spool.  Bolts and 2 casing valves were found to be missing.
While disconnecting a 2inch hose from a pump the employee scalded his right knee with hot water.  The incident resulted in a lost workday case.
A helicopter with crew was conducting Emergency Evacuation operations due to civil war.  A mechanic was hit by gunfire in the area of the chest.
The deceased was changing worn-out tires on a 38 seater personnel bus when the improvised support on which the bus was resting collapsed on him.
While placing a battery on a lagoon for a seismic survey a worker approached the centre of the lagoon (too far from shore) without a lifejacket.
A flatbed vehicle being used to deliver deisel for field based seismic activities rolled onto its side in soft sand.  The driver escaped unhurt.
A man caught his hand between a combination ring spanner and a vertical scaffolding pole resulting in partial amputation of the left forefinger.
On 21-04-2016 at the start of the works on the Roof deck of the Platform, a contractor noticed that a valve of a 3•À_•À_ pipe was lying on the deck.
The victim was involved in a road accident after his vehicle overturned. He had oversteered while negotiating a bend in the road. (LWD 30 days).
Tow bridle failed when anchor handling vessel could not maintain position to safely pass the tow bridle back to semi-submersible drilling rig.
While preparing the 3rd run of a perforation operation, a detonator which was placed inside the safety tube exploded just after being checked.
While transferring from barge to supply vessel, was struck on the head by a falling rope/chain when it became snagged when the boat pulled away.
A member of a seismic crew was drowned whilst attempting to recover a battery that had fallen overboard. Body was found without a life jacket on.
The deceased lost control of a tipper truck whilst ascending a slope and rolled backwards. He jumped from the vehicle and received head injuries.
Two process operators went down to platform boat landing to retrieve diesel and water hoses from the sea. One washed into the sea by rough waves.
A generator got out of control for over speed causing a loud noise and smoke.  The engine was shut down manually and the deluge system activated.
A vehicle was involved in a serious collision with another car which strayed across the lanes.  The driver and passenger were not seriously hurt.
During the welding process above the tank No.18 the fire in the tank No.18 occurred. The fire was successfully extinguished in its initial stage.
Explosion and fire at offshore platform during depressurization in preparation of planned shutdown. Six (6) personnel injured from the incident.
Gas fire. Industrial accident. Breakage of a fuel gas line connection on a compressor, due to vibration or age of equipment. No personal injuries
Injury of the left fist of technician for measurement when handling dynamo device. The worker was transported to hospital. Alcohol test negative.
Ribs cracked when crushed between container and crane load during drilling from a semi-submersible platform.  Resulted in 75 days unfit for work.
Total black out occurred due to tripping of Gas Turbines cause by flash over of 11KV bus bar at bus section panel of the gas processing platform.
While descending a ladder a contractor slipped missing the last two rungs.  He sustained swelling to the knee and was unfit for work for 73 days.
While preparing a pad location, a front end loader inadvertently struck and severed the wellhead causing an uncontrolled release of natural gas.
Helicopter crash with cause not being determined (Helicopter not recovered). Investigation by NTSB is ongoing with report due in May or June 1992.
The worker was struck by a walking beam during a well pressure test.  The cause of this accident was an unsafe act committed by the well servicer.
While attempting to change a sealing element on a Grant rotating head, the seal assembly was propelled upward striking the individual in the head.
The tip of the crane fell and hit the helideck during the unloading of a container.  Weight: 3 kg and height: 8 metres. There was a person nearby.
Struck in face with hoist sling.  Was assisting in transfer of drilling rig mast from boat to platform.
Vehicle collided with truck whilst trying to overtake it.  Three other passenger recieved major injuries and the remaining 3 were slightly injured.
A contractor driver was injured in a head on collision with another vehicle.  The incident resulted in the person being unfit for work for 26 days.
A helicopter experienced mechanical problem whilst delivering a load to a rig site. On inspection, it was noted that one of the rotors was cracked.
Contractor was hospitalized with a broken left cheek bone and cuts to face.  A winch hook slipped off the loading hitch and hit contractor in face.
Hook on air winch opened up and shackle fell out of the hook landing at the back edge of Driller's console approximately 8' from Driller's console.
A production "T" pipe ruptured striking a worker while fixing a filtration on the choke box of a well.  The pipeline failed due to material fatigue.
the deceased fell into lake Maracaibo from a personnel transportation vessel. The reason is still unknown. The deceased was not wearing a life-vest.
Eyebolt failed during lifting of PowerFrame. PowerFrame swung back across the rig floor nearly hitting crew members before striking the Hydraracker.
Rig crew had been tripping in hole after conducting open hole logging operations.  A break in tripping operations was taken due to a lighting storm.
The bundwall of waste water lagoon at the Refinery collapsed, causing major flooding in the neighbouring tank farm area of Terminal and Export Dept.
While rope access worker was lowering himself from height, unintentionally, he stepped on Low Pressure point isolation valve causing train trapping.
A contract scaffolder slipped and fell 6 metres from an elevated piperack on a construction project, fracturing both wrists and rupturing his spleen.
A Contractor's employees were performing a job at the oilfield, when oil blowout happened. The strong wind sprayed the oil outside the pad territory.
A military pick-up and a contractor pick up were circulating in opposite directions on the pipeline right-of-way when they collided head on at KP13.
It was noticed from IFRII radar that the N-W standby BUOY changed position due to bad weather conditions. The drifting distance was around 0.5 miles.
The victim injured his left leg when it was pinned between the casings while he was unloading the casing from the truck. He received 2 days off work.
The victim, a carpenter, received a cut on his left arm when some metal sheets he was loading onto a truck slipped. He was  given leave for two days.
A diver drowned while checking a sublacustrial crude line in Lake Maracaibo, because water entered the diving equipment he was using (not autonomous).
Setting two 30" pipes for welding one of them was violently moved hitting the victim. This accident occurred in a tender line barge on Lake Maracaibo.
The incident occurred at a construction site. A portacabin was lifted by a tornado force storm and landed on the injured party causing fatal injuries.
The Operator entered a restricted area where heavy loads were being lifted by crane. The swivel hook failed and the person was struck by a heavy load.
While installing/aligning a well-pumping unit a worker was hit and killed by its structure when the system of manual breaks that held it became loose.
A vehicle with a driver and 6 passengers, traveling at high speed, ran off the road. The car flipped several times, resulting in 7 Lost Time Injuries.
An earthmoving foreman sustained 2nd/3rd degree burns on 40-50% of his body when he came into contact with a 33 kV high voltage electric power line.
An improperly installed 'sight glass gasket' caused an estimate of 43 m3 of 14.86% H2S gas release from the separator unit over a period of 20 minutes
An inspection crowbar fell from a travelling crane. Weight: 0.4 kg. height: 9.6. There were 4 personnel nearby. The crowbar fell close to one of them.
Expat personnel fell through a manhole left unattended during personnel transfer to offshore locations. He sustained injuries to his right chest area.
Worker was knocked off balance when struck by a moving cuttings chute and fell 1.3m from top of cuttings skip to deck resulting in a lost time injury.
The deceased was introducing a pig into a 30" gas pipe. Suddenly the tool was ejected, hitting him. The pipeline had not been previously depressurized.
A water tanker tilted on one side after it became stuck in the sand. The driver and helper received minor cuts and bruises as a result of the accident.
Cable tray cover fell from the first floor of PQ MCC cable entry point to ground level on PQ main deck walkway due to wind blow during chopper landing.
Crude Oil Leak occurred when a grader belonging to a contractor hit the wellhead accidentally during a preparatory job(grading work) for Rig movement.
Main sliding door of helicopter slid opened when helicopter lifted off Heli-pad.  The Pilot immediately re-landed and the door was re-shut and locked.
A contractor carpenter was using a pneumatic impact hammer when he accidentally hammered his finger.  He was taken to hospital and was given 2 days off.
A trailer was carrying the Rig engine (generator pack). About 1km before the destination the driver was negotiating a curve and the vehicle rolled over.
During crane testing, a walkway grating weighing approximately 22 kg was dislodged and fell approximately 15 m to area below. No injuries were reported.
The top section of the mast tilted due to sheared holding plate fell on to the drill deck while lowering the telescopic section. No injury to personnel.
Difficulties were experienced whilst attempting to remove a bell-nipple assembly.  The assembly tilted and dropped a short distance, crushing the victim.
The worker received an electric shock when he came into contact with the circuit of the control panel of a barge, which was being restored in a workshop.
While lifting a load from the deck the load slipped and the crane block descended under freefall in such an arc that it hit and then pinned the deceased.
3 gas detectors detected a leak. The power supply and production were shut down. The deluge was released. The personell mustering went according to plan.
A bolt fell from the top of the separator onto the deck. There were personnel nearby but none were injured. The working area was not sufficiently secure.
A Roustabout was struck by a 9 5/8 casing and his lower right leg was broken. Lack of supervision and coordination were the basic causes of the incident.
A third party was hospitalized for surgery on a fractured leg received when a drum of chemical fell on his ankle/leg while being loaded from the pick-up.
During working with the gate on the helideck a tool hit a man in his face. His nose was cut. In other circumstances he could have been seriously injured.
Whilst picking up a single joint of 4" drill pipe up the V-door, the lifting nubbin failed and the pipe slid back down the V-door onto the catwalk below.
During the construction of a drilling site a compacting truck moving backwards struck the site engineer who was inattentive talking on the cellular phone.
Employee and two contractor employees were fatally injured when a life boat was involved in a fire while servicing an oil well off the coast of Louisiana.
A fire started in the main generator building as a result of a pressureized lube oil system leak on a Ruston gas engine powering an electricity generator.
A scaffolder was going to the scaffold storage area. He did not see an opening in the grating floor and fell down 5 metres. He incurred fracture injuries.
After starting up after a shut down two gas detectors were activated on the top deck,  NAS 2.0.  The field center and the accociated field were shut down.
Base Camp Mechanic had just jacked up the vehicle and was preparing to do the repair to the vehicle. Just at that moment the jack slipped off the chassis.
Furnace fire caused 2 employee lost time injuries.  Second employee suffered 2nd degree burn on right hand and earlobe and 1st degree burn on right cheek.
Seizure event in the swivel stack handling the firewater line entering the turret from the FPSO topsides, affecting the deluge coverage within the turret.
The incinerator was being put in service during the start up of the plant. All of a sudden there was a smoke and fire with explosion on the incinerator.
The injured caught his 2nd and 3rd fingers between the flywheel when he slipped. He was fitting the flywheel guard when the accident occurred. (LWD 1 day)
The injured person had the tip of his right hand index finger amputated when it was caught between two pieces of steel he had been working on. (LWD 1 day)
The vehicle operator was apparently behind the truck when it moved. The operator's arm was broken when it was caught between the truck and a pumping jack.
Three workers received injury to their upper leg, abdomen, shoulder and skull when a vehicle drove into a light pole they were working on and struck them.
A small security boat at a wellhead tripod offshore was struck by a fishing boat and sank within 10 minutes. Crew members were rescued by the fishing boat.
One of the workers, while doing vaccum cleaning, stepped on the manway grating which suddenly disengaged from its hinges and fell to the lower first level.
Two drill pipes were being transferred from the pipedeck to the catwalk on the platform.  A magnetic pipehandling gantry crane was used for this operation.
When they were working with preventive maintenance on a safety valve the mechanic fell from the pig lock and down onto the main deck. The distance was 3 m.
While checking out the tong jaws, the tong operator was loading them back into the basket and caught his glove/finger on one of the jaws against the tong.
A supervisor was accidentally hit on the head and killed when the crane book became loose during a valve lifting operation in a gas plant on Lake Maracaibo.
Employee slipped in heavy snow and slid, head first, down a three foot slope. Employee died of blunt force trauma to the head upon impact with a metal post.
Mr. Ariyabut was apparently walking on top of a 24" pipeline and fell in the path of a side boom which was tracking along the line to the new work location.
The employee was occupied stamp marking a bracing with 2 anodes, sitting in front of it when the bracing rotated and the anode fell on the employee's chest.
The technician, working on an electrical substation, received an electrical discharge when he touched one electrical bar of a breaker conducting 4160 volts.
A contractor vehicle rolled over after going off road. While travelling from the airstrip towards a well, the driver lost control when taking a sharp turn.
Diver had attached one 25te shackle to one of the 55te shackles on the casing and was attempting to attach the second 25te shackle to the same 55te shackle.
During transfer by crane of steel plates from a supply vessel to the platform, 3 plates fell into the sea. Poor rigging was considered to be the main cause.
Offshore marine vessel was approaching the platform for personnel transfer. The vessel lost control and hit the platform and boat landing aluminium gangway.
While performing construction work, an employee received impact on the left posterior side of hemi thorax caused by the turbulence of a Sikorsky helicopter.
Man lost overboard from Trident XIV in Liverpool Bay, presumed dead. Extensive sea and air search failed to locate body. Police treated incident as suicide.
Pneumatic pressure testing of a jacket installation buoyancy tank was being conducted when one compartment failed causing a catastrophic failure of the tank.
The victim, the Captain of a boat, received 2nd degree burns on his lower abdomen, legs, thighs, arms and hands. His clothes had been set alight when a fire
When carrying out chemical cleaning the operator got fluid in his face and on his body. The injury was not serious. He suffered some blistering on the chest.
While assisting the Rig Mechanic to install hoses to the rig camp engine, a Roustabout began to feel dizzy.  This was due to heat exhaustion and dehydration.
A loaded concrete mixer truck descending on a road, skidded off, rolling down 12 metres.  A worker, who was holding onto the outside of the cabin, was killed.
Accident occurred between 0115 and 0200 hours.  The truck driver was unable to control the vehicle's steering as it descended down a hill on the road to Maau.
One person fell to the sea from a suspected dislodged grating.  During the rescue attempt a crew member from the standby vessel entered the sea and also died.
A Crude oil tanker toppled over on the left hand side of the road. The driver lost control in an attempt to avoid a buffalo which came rushing on to the road.
Failure of contractor to implement heat management procedures in remote desert area resulted in several reports of heat stress in members of the seismic crew.
After take off from a drilling barge in Lake Maracaibo, a  helicopter (Bell Jet Ranger, model YV-333) precipitated to the lake, resulting in a nurse's fatality
The deceased lost control of his vehicle. The vehicle hit a crash barrier and the deceased, who was not wearing a seat belt, was thrown through the windscreen.
The deceased was  climbing the derrick ladder to reach the monkey board, suddenly he lost balance and fell down. The rig was being used in workover activities.
The deceased was hit and pinned with a mooring cable during barge mooring operations. He sustained a broken leg, fractured skull and massive internal injuries.
When lighting a flare a gas accumulation ignited, reaching four workers in the location area.  This accident resulted from violation of operational procedures.
During routine perforating activities, loss of control through procedural failure resulted in a blow out.  No ignition occurred and no injuries were sustained.
Flexible coupling on charge pump failed during milling operations discharging 115 barrels of oil based mud into the lower pump room. No injuries were reported.
The injured person broke his arm and backbones when the vehicle he was driving rolled over. He had been testing radio reception and looking at the watt meter.
When pressuring up a pig receiver (after the removal of pigs and closing of the door), the door opened unexpectedly, hitting the victim in the lower belly area.
While the operator was working on the platform he fell in the Lake and died by drowning.  The accident occurred as a result of a violation of safety procedures.
Worker who was not authorised to drive lost control of vehicle.  Vehicle rolled over resulting in the death of the driver and serious injuries to the passenger.
10 3/4" casing fell off the catwalk machine when it was running up to the drilling deck. Weight: 1.1 tonnes. Length: 12 metres. The section fell down 12 metres.
A contractor was caught between a falling section of the standpipe and the rig ladder. He was hospitalised with 3 fractured ribs and a partially collapsed lung.
A subcontractor employee tripped and fell approximately 4.5 meters from an incomplete scaffolding platform. The injured person suffered a fracture to the skull.
A workshop technician was checking the free rotation of a shaft using a scaffolding pipe when the pipe slipped from the bolts and hit the technician's forehead.
No fall arrest equipment were used during transfer of two people from a cherry picker basket and onto a block, which was tilted in vertical and horizontal axis.
Operator sustained hand injuries whilst assisting Maintenance personnel install a 24-inch diameter spiral wound gasket. Injury resulted in 49 days of Lost Time.
Supply vessel collided with the Drillship while working alongside discharging cargo, resulting in visual, but minor damage to the Stbd Aft corner of the vessel.
The company's carpenter supervisor was driving a vehicle at night when he encountered an uneven road. He lost control of his vehicle and skidded into the ditch.
Uncontrolled release of lubricating oil caused a fire at a platform. There were no injuries.  The fire however damaged one of two turbine driven generator sets.
A contractor vessel collided with a third party speedboat resulting in the drowning of 1 contractor and 2 third parties. None of the 3 were wearing life jackets.
A contractor was unloading hot condensate from storage tanks to a vac truck when the hose connection came off and sprayed hot condensate on the contractor's leg.
A helper received slight injury while he jumped from the tractor trolley while the tractor trolley got tilted in front of MPT main gate due to mechanical damage.
A steel chain holder box from a chain hoist fell from height onto a work platform. There were no personnel on the platform at the time and therefore no injuries.
An important gas release has been observed at the exit of gas heat exchanger E3940 (70 bar), which was feeding a unit after fracturing of a 3/4' gauge conection.
Mechanics were working on a fire water pump when suddenly an overhead isolation valve wheel chain assembly fell down and hit the adjacent pump discharger area.
While loading a rack of gas bottles on to a boat, the boat landing pontoon capsized and two contractor workers jumped into the water. They were retrieved safely.
A worker was descending from the barge 3957 when he fell in the Lake and died by drowning.  The accident occurred as a result of a violation of safety procedures.
During the installation of pipe in a ditch approx 3 metres deep and 1.5 metres wide, one of the walls of the ditch collapsed, fatally crushing one of the workers.
the deceased were killed by a flash which occurred while connecting the tubing and casing to improve the oil well surface connections in an oil well installation.
3 company electrical engineers involved in an incident where a single vehicle rolled over.  They were sent to hospital for treatment and were given days off work.
A pipefitter was cutting into a brine loading line.  On cutting through the pipe liquid squirted into his face.  He pulled back and cut his knee with the grinder.
A small gas leakage occurred from a grease nipple on a wing valve on the wellhead. No detection, visual observation. Manual NAS, staff mustered according to plan.
Due to sudden adverse weather condition (poor visibility) the chopper flying to an offshore platform was cancelled, leaving 20 personnel stranded on the platform.
The right side of the plate clamp slipped from the plate and hit the hard barricade during crane's changing position from concave to convex. No injuries reported.
First engineer electrocuted while using portable electrical vacuum pump.  Immediate cause was an incorrectly wired extension lead, which made the pump casing live.
A furnace failure resulted in a flash fire.  An operator on an access ladder was caught in the fire and sustained first and second degree burns to 16% of his body.
A lump of lube oil  fell from the crane tip to the deck, 4 metres from the MOB boat. Height: 25 metres, weight: 0,7 kg. There were 2 personnel inside the MOB boat.
An assistant driller was struck by the rotating tong jaws causing injuries to his upper arms whilst changing the hydraulic tong without isolating the power source.
During airless cleaning in the drilling rig the hook from the wier came loose. The worker could have fallen down 17-19 metres. He managed to fasten the hook again.
Gas was detected in the shaker room in the drilling module, 1x20% LEL og 1x60% LEL. Production was shut down. The wells were closed and the situation investigated.
Severe corrosion of 32" gas export line found underneath passive fire protection. Production was reduced and a temporary repair executed. Permanent repair in 2010.
When the victim jumped down from the transformer tank at a height of 3 feet after removing the final bolt attaching to the tank, he sprained his ankle. (LWD 1 day)
The two victims performed maintenance work on a lifeboat.  the lifeboat was unintentionally released and crashed into the sea thirty meters below the lifeboat deck.
A FHSE Coordinator noticed, while conducting area rounds, that one worker was inside an acid gas removal unit without a contractor HSE Officer or Holewatch present.
While lifting the drill string off the slips with the DP elevators, three back up dies out of the TDS pipe handler fell to the rig floor. No injuries were reported.
A Contractor Maintenance man was going to do maintenance work on the level transmitter of the reflux drum of a deethaniser column (cleaning up the line by methanol).
A fire occurred at the intermediate mud tank on the drilling site due to the overheating of the belts of the centrifugal pump, located by mistake on top of the tank.
During commissioning of fuel gas - they pressure balanced without using the procedure for pressure balance. The flange was not tight. There were no personell nearby.
Lifting of sea assembly: During lifting of equipment for seal assembly a person was crushed between the equipment and casing. The weight of the equipment was 750 kg.
Two helicopters, carrying 11 and 10 persons respectively, were on collision course. Avoiding action was taken and they missed each other by approximately 100 metres.
While taking a left turn, the trailor met with an accident. The road conditions were muddy and slushy because of recent rains and the trailer skidded and overturned.
Contractor pick-up collided with 3rd party saloon car.  The car driver died on the spot whilst the pick-up driver sustained minor injuries.  There were no passengers.
Contractor pick-up truck transporting twelve members of a well service crew overturned several times rolling down a 25 metre embankment and resulting in one fatality.
Two contractor employees and one company employee were fatally injured when a life boat was involved in a fire while servicing an oil well off the coast of Louisiana.
A pedestrian walked in front of the vehicle - the driver applied the brakes and turned away from the pedestrian, which eventually resulted in the vehicle overturning.
A worker fell from height whilst working off a beam, resulting in a broken left tibia and dislocated left elbow. This incident has has resulted in a Lost Time Injury.
After starting up oil production after a shut down a stuffing box on a valve was leaking and caused a NAS 1.2. The personnel mustered according to the emergency plan.
Helicopter (S-76C) experienced loss of power from #2 engine (right hand engine) shortly after take-off and returned to heliport using one engine inoperative approach.
The platform crane was being lowered when the auxillary hook struck the jib head block causing the auxillary hook line to break. The block fell 20 metres to the deck.
The well on the platform dropped approx. 50cm when unlatching coiled tubing ijector from riser. The incident caused a total shut down of the platform for three weeks.
Vehicle under contract to the Company was returning to the highway to head back to base when the vehicle was struck by an 18 wheeler. A first aid injury was reported.
When manoeuvering a crane, a 6" recycle valve on a gas pipeline of CRU c-101 & c-102 Compressor stage 2 and 3 was accidentally disconnected and caused a gasleak.
A 4x4 Toyota Land Cruiser Station wagon containing three employees flipped onto its passenger (right) side.  Each occupant was wearing a seatbelt.  No one was injured.
A contractor worker was tripping a drill pipe when his arm was caught between an elevator and a drill pipe.  He was sent to hospital and was given a few days off work.
A metal sheet (4kgs) fell on a contractor when it slipped from a hook while being lifted during roofing installation. The fitter suffered a minor abrasion to his back.
A pressurized air hose has been disconnected while hot bolting in progress of MR vapour line check valve due to loosing of one hose joint which was not tightened well.
Catastrophic failure of gas compressor turbine during operation. Significant damage to equipment and enclosure. Reduced gas export potential. No injuries to personnel.
Personnel were found using plain rope to lower the big beams from AGR Amine Absorber instead of using crane or certified lifting equipment as per Task Risk Assessment.
Two employees were assembling a metallic structure in a high voltage area. When raising a tape measure, they suffered an electric discharge, resulting in severe burns.
When the victim sprained his ankle when he jumped down from the transformer tank at a height of 3 feet after removing the final bolt attaching to the tank. (LWD 1 day)
A guyed 39 metre tall communication tower failed and collapsed while 2 contractor employees were working at the top of the tower to dismantle the communication antenna.
At the time of the thunderstorm, two policemen were inside a shelter in the surroundings of Cusiana 2A (LTT).  An indirect lightning strike killed one of the policemen.
2 gas dectors detected a leak in the process area. The personell mustering went according to plan. A gasket between the transmitter and pressure metering had blown out.
A contract worker suffered partial amputation of his right index and middle fingers when they were trapped between an outer and inner mast of a pallet stacking machine.
At 15:55hrs on one Offshore Platform, an alarm both audible and flashing was detected on the Fire and Gas panel in the control room, identifying •À_•À_Fire on Pump Deck•À_•À_.
Injured Person was assisting the HV Tech by conducting Point to Point testing. While conducting the testing, he sustained an electrical shock of approximately 220Volts.
Newly installed flowline spool piece had parted on a wellhead area, activating gas detectors, initiating an Emergency Shut Down. 828 kg of hydrocarbon gas was released.
The victim fell to the ground from a height of 1.8 metres when he was going down a stepladder. One leg of the stepladder had collapsed, causing him to fall. (LWD 1 day)
Unsecured grating weighing approx 15 kg fell from the dome roof of the firewater tank where construction work was in progress to an area below that was not cordoned off
A rig was moved by a crane in order to place it at the well location.  The rig caught one high power line (13.4 kv.) causing the death of the operator who was moving it.
A supervisor was struck by a flange which was ejected under 1200 pounds of pressure.  This accident occurred when a pipeline was hydrostatically tested in a gas station.
Contract engineer was driving to production area when gunfire shots were fired at his vehicle, fatally wounding him and causing the vehicle to crash. Terrorist activity.
Sabotage caused substantial oil leakage.  During the spill containment, oil was ignited, likely by a diesel-driven pump unit, and two contractors died in resulting fire.
The Crane Driver had been assisting with routine deck operations supporting a team of contractors to move the workover unit. It was being skidded from the North well bay
To check the level in a portable offshore container, an operator had to climb into an exposed position with no protection against falling from the platform into the sea.
When the injured person was leaning over the railing, trying to attach the winch, the monkeytail hit the person on his back and hips and crushed him against the railing.
The lifting head and vertical boom assemblies of a Marco Monobeam automated pipe rack system fell from the derrick and struck a floorman resulting in his immediate death.
Activists shot at helicopter whilst take off from drilling SP location on seismic line; four persons injured •À__one seriously (150 days incapacity); 4 LWDC, 181 lost days.
An electrician received minor burns to his hand while repairing the cable attachment. An unknown person had engaged the switch and caused the wires to spark. (LWD 2 days)
At 12:07 hours of June 26, 12, a full 500ml plastic water bottle was dropped to the rig floor from the monkey board. No personnel were within 2 meters of the impact area.
The injured employee (IE) was descending stairs in the office, when the IE slipped or tripped and fell down the stairs to the landing. IE hit their head on the landing.
When the helicopter was approaching the helideck, the drilling crane operator raised the crane boom.  Potential existed for severe or fatal injury to one or both persons.
While lifting some construction beams, a lifting rope pick-up hook became entangled and swung hitting the Contractor worker's face.  The was medivaced and given time off.
A Bell helicopter crashed into the Java Sea killing the pilot and 3 passengers. The cause appears to be a single equipment failure of the transmission mount pylon spindle.
Transporting company employees to Jose Terminal, the Chevrolet Suzuky drove by a contractor employee crashed against to an electrical post. The driver died in this event.
Walking on the roof of a testing production tank, in order to measure its level, an operator fell into the tank through a manhole which cap failed under the worker weight
A fire broke out in a compressor due to oil overheating. It took one hour to extinguish the fire which damaged two compressors and adjacent cable ways. Nobody was injured.
A pipe fitter injured his left hand and finger when he accidentally grasped the rotating drill bit of a pneumatic drill while attempting to prevent the drill from falling.
A plate fell from a trally which was parked and was fastened onto the hand rail, The weight of the plate was 2 kg and the plate fell down 15 metres. One person was nearby.
A portion of the helideck net at STD platform weighing 50 kgs fell down by 8 meters to the main deck, due to impact from the crane boom, while the crane boom was swinging.
Company vehicle collided with a 3rd party vehicle on the highway causing a fatal injury to the driver of the 3rd party vehicle. The company driver escaped grievous injury.
During deployment of ice management equipment including a buoy system a member of the crew was struck by a fender buoy breaking his ankle and dragging him across the deck.
The coupling between an air hose and an air-operated drill split when the pressure was turned on. The injured person was struck by the air pressure in the face and throat.
A shovel overturned during the construction of a rain water  channel. The shovel operator died  when he was caught betwen the heavy equipment and the bottom of the channel
Victim jumped from a storey building office and landed on a sharp object which cut his leg, when armed robbers invaded Warri office.  Died of cardiac arrest due to tetanus.
A contractor employee hit an 11KV overhead line feeding to gathering center by a tripper truck while passing under the overhead cables. No injuries but power tripped to GC.
A drain line on a compressor pulsation damper drum failed, which resulted in a release of hydrocarbon vapour. The release was isolated locally. No injuries or asset damage.
Approx 4-5km from the pipeyard the truck encountered a road vehicle overtaking dangerously which in turn caused the truck driver to take evasive action and brake severely.
Falling object: A transportable gas holder fell down to the deck below. No personell were nearby. The distance to the walkway was 5 metres. Height: 9 metres, weight: 13 kg.
The injured sustained a cut on his forefinger when a piece of steel was dropped on it. The injured and another person had been lowering the steel to the ground. (LWD 1 day)
A man died whilst diving.  It was noticed that there were no air bubbles coming from this scuba gear and when the body was recovered he was dead.
While changing a bulb lamp in an electrical sub-station, the worker received an electrical shock which caused his death.  This accident happened by violation of safety rule.
Front passenger side wheel of Toyota station wagon became detached from the front axle. The vehicle was travelling at 10kph. The vehicle had just returned from maintenance.
While using a grinding machine on the top of vent tower, a spark ignited the gas leaking from the isolation valve.  The fire was put out by the use of fire monitors on deck.
A minor LNG leak reported at the battery limit of Train 2 from the 40" RDL valve's upstream and downstream flanges. Less than 0.1 kg/sec release rate for less than 2 minutes.
A Truck slipped down a steep embankment by the side of the road while negotiating a narrow passage developed due to breakdown of another trailer on the middle of a road slope
During dismounting of a heat exchanger a blind flange weighing more than three tonnes dropped 50 cm upon a scaffold, damaging the scaffolding structure. No injuries to staff.
While blowing down a sand trap, there was a surge in pressure which caused threaded piping to pull loose.  The piping hit the injured person throwing him back approx 40 feet.
Contractor died after being struck by a falling casing joint which rolled from the pipe rack.  The design and construction of the pipe rack was found to be the primary factor.
Contractor lost control of vehicle, causing it to crash through barrier leading to the vehicle ferry.  He was unable to free himself from the vehicle and drowned in the river.
A 2.5 kg pipe shoe stopper was observed lying on the ground between columns 18 and 19. It is suspected to have fallen from Condensate water line pipe at a height of 20 metres.
A beam clamp chain hoist weighing approximately 85 pounds fell thirty feet to the deck floor. A first aid injury from the falling chain sustained by a technician was reported.
An onshore construction worker was injured when he accidentally bumped into a 4 inch pipe.  The pipe fell from the angle bars bracing and struck the injured person in the leg.
At 23:15 hours the driller experienced an uncontrolled descent of the drillstring, travelling block and Top Drive Drilling System (TDS) which came to rest on the rotary table.
Blowout on swamp barge rig. Ignition two hours later. No injuires; little pollution (gas well); main cause was the bypass of the shear rams by the upper and lower choke lines.
During work on the BOP deck a hammer dropped to the wellhead deck, all barriers where in place, there were no employees within the area of the drop and of no danger to anyone.
A 30-seater bus was returning from Calabar on official business and was involved in a collision with a pedestrian. The pedestrian received fatal injuries and died at the scene.
Employee of contracting drilling team drove a vehicle from the job site.  At an ascending road the vehicle got in trouble, rolled backwards, turned over and crushed the driver.
Tyre failure caused the vehicle to veer off the road and to subsequently roll over. The deceased received fatal head injuries when the vehicle cab was crushed during roll over.
While oil was being transferred by a diesel pump into trucks, gas evolved and was ignited by the pump exhaust causing a flash fire.  Worker handling pump was covered by flames.
A worker stepped in between a moving forklift and a 400 bbl tank.  He was wedged in between and fractured his collar bone.  He was sent to hospital and was given time off work.
Charter aircraft struck a flock of birds at 3000ft shortly after take-off.  As a result it sustained fan blade and turbine damage to one of the engines and returned to airport.
Modifications made to scaffolding: U Heads were connected to access scaffolds to support formwork on 11m high scaffolding when conducting form erection and bolt alignment work.
One person was electrocuted while he was working with a coupling bar. He used a measuring device. The measuring device indicate 0 deflection - it should have indicate 24 volt.
Contractor was attacked and killed by one of his co-workers.  There were 10 personnel onboard the platform at the time of the incident (including the attacker and the deceased).
Employee of contracting well work intended to install a guy wire of rig.  When he was positioning the wire it touched an overhead 13.8 KV power line and electrocuted the victim.
Mitsubishi Montero 4x4 vehicle with driver & 2 passengers caused to swerve off width restricted gravel road by oncoming truck into 40m deep ravine. Rear seat passenger died.
While changing an insulator from an electric tower an electrician carelessly made contact with one of the energized circuits and received an electric discharge which killed him.
