After loading the Scaffoldings material to the Canter (truck). Driver took a sharp turn to move out, He hit the scaffolder nearby standing with the cycle. The cycle was damaged.
The assistant driller was attaching the bridle line thimble with Gin pole with the help of a pipe wrench. He was leaning forward and lost his balance and fell down about 6 feet.
A gas leak occurred from an Oxy- Acetylene torch leaking hose and resulted into a small fire when the gas came into contact with the sparks generated from adjacent grinding work.
The boom of a trackhoe, being transported on the back of a lowboy, came into contact with a railway bridge overpass causing significant damage to one of four bridge span I-beams.
The operator caught his ring finger of left hand between pipe and handrail. The laceration was cleaned and dressed and the contractor was transported to nearest medical facility.
When a barge was being towed in lake Maracaibo a sailor was struck by a rope, which suddenly loose, causing his fall on the barge deck, hitting his head, dying by cranial fracture
A contractor caught his elbow in a cement mixer causing a deep lateral wound to the right elbow area. He was sent to hospital for treatment and returned to work three weeks later.
At 1330 hours on 26 July 2009,a team of 7 men were assigned to spool the drill line at derrick which was in horizontal position resting on head stand as part of rig up operation.
Two seamen were injured when struck by a mooring rope on a supply vessel while casting off from a drilling rig. One sailor suffered a fractured arm and the second a fractured hip.
When drilling, a very high pressure layer was encountered. During the well control situation the casing failed and a leak occurred from the cellar. This well was abandoned safely.
Local youths climbed onto low-bed trailer.  Whilst travelling over an uneven road surface the vehicle's ramp fell open and the security chain snapped.  One youth fell off and died.
The incident occurred on an FPSO. The IP opened the observation tank•À_•À_s inspection hatch and was drenched in hot water. This resulted in the IP sustaining extensive scalding/burns.
A ~0.9 lb bolt failed in the top drive dolly track alignment flange and fell approximately 145 ft to the rig floor, coming to rest about 2 ft outside the drill floor red zone area.
A degasser fell onto a worker who was disassembling it, causing injuries to the worker that resulted in permanent disability. No proper operational procedure existed for this task.
A security guard was bitten on the hand by a Scorpion. He was treated with pain killers and kept under observation to ensure no allergic reaction had occured. Not life threatening.
At about 1.30 am a major fire incident occurred at the living camp.  The incident was found to be caused by a substandard electrical wiring system.  Three rooms were badly damaged.
During bottom hole assembly (BHA) handling operations the near perpendicular BHA dropped from the elevators as a result of the Lifting Nubbin slipping through the 65/8" Elevator.
During climbing up the ladder the worker of the contractor company fell down and got minor injuries. HSE representative of the company immediately on site took preventive measures.
During maintenance work on top of the walkway roof, a contractor fell approximately 12 feet while descending.  The incident resulted in the person being unfit for work for 20 days.
Several  fingers were broken and a deep cut sustained between two fingers when the injured person's finger was crushed while working with riser equipment . He was sent to hospital.
While working on live electrical equipment on a water pumping rig, a shortcircuit occurred when a tool fell down onto the equipment. The resulting electric arc injured two workers.
Diver was cutting 30" * 1" drive pipe to complete P&A of well at Eugene Island 315A. Depth was 275 feet. Explosion occurred at stub and knocked diver unconscious and he drowned.
The driver lost control of the vehicle and it overturned. The driver was not wearing a seat belt and was thrown from the vehicle. Excessive speed was probably a contributory factor.
A contractor driver lost control of his vehicle and rolled over 3 times before coming to a stop.  He was flown to the hospital with a severe head wound.  He was off work for 7 days.
A contractor electrical engineer was responding to a power outage in the area when he was involved in an accident where a single vehicle rolled over.  He was given 30 days off work.
One person was washing clothes at a hand basin, another one was using the toilet. A fire occured on the hand basin and extended to the toilet. It caused burn injuries to two people.
A chain saw operator was hit by a falling tree which fell in an unpredicted direction.  The tree was 300 mm dia and 25 m high and entwined with another tree 250 mm dia and 24 m high.
A 4x2 metre flat bottomed punt used by the Oil Spill Response Team sank while deploying 3 new buoys along the export line in the river where the shipping lane meets the export line.
In extreme weather conditions, a truck swerved to miss 2 large deer on the road causing vehicle to run into a ditch and scrape up against trees.  Passenger side of truck was damaged.
While removing a gas plug from the crude transfer line, a small amount of accumulated oil and gas gushed and caused a flash fire due to a flood light being not being explosive-proof.
A roustabout stepped onto a loose grating which covered access to a mixing tank.  He landed in 1m of drilling fluid and was fatally injured by the impact of the rotating paddle mixer.
A truck, whilst reversing, hit the victim who was working on the installation of a shelter structure, against a valve nipple on the manifold.  The impact resulted in a fatal injury.
A contractor left exposed wires unprotected at the end of the day's work.  Another contractor energised wires while working in the dark.  Potential existed for electrocution and fire.
A contractor rig chargehand was hanging a power tong when he slipped on the floor, bruising his elbow.  He received treatment at the site clinic and was off work for a couple of days.
The rig floor gave way and the individual fell six feet and the floor grating fell on top of him.  The  contractor was hospitalised for one night for surgery to repair jaw and pallet.
When the Electrician Supv was inspecting the air condition motor and moved the belt of the motor, his right hand ring finger was pinched caused an open wound and fracture. (LTA 1 day)
While shifting a 4 inch, 12 ft. long steel pipe placed on 2 A - frame supports for wrapping, the pipe fell on the left foot of the worker causing injury. 7 days' medical rest advised.
A crew of contractor workers were opening a trench to make cathodic protection improvements on a gas pipeline, when the pipeline suddenly failed, releasing a significant amount of gas.
A Sudanese driver was travelling back from work in the Muglad area when he lost control of the vehicle and rolled.  He sustained severe head trauma and died on the way to the hospital.
The engine room water-tight door swung open and struck victim, causing him to strike his back on the handrail.  Although he was OK at first, he collapsed later & stopped breathing.
A 4wd car was travelling eastwards when it had a puncture in one tire after passing a bend. The driver lost control of the vehicle and as a result the vehicle left the road and rolled.
A Drilling Operator employee was disabled in connection with a accident while drilling a  well. Four fingers on his left hand were injured and three of the finger tips were amputated.
Crane rope connector failed during maintenance activity. Thirty five metres of 35 mm crane rope fell approximately 35 - 50 metres to the galley landing area. No injuries were reported.
During construction activities a piece of steel weighing approximately 1.5 kgs fell approximately 16 meters from a platform to the ground. The object landed 2 meters from a work group.
When an excavator operator was trying to release a faulty (malfunction) spring lever of a trailer ramp suddenly the lever released and hit his face causing him serious facial injuries.
A contract wireline operator was injured when a helicopter crushed him between the helicopter body and the logging cabin roof where he was located to hook the load under the helicopter.
A leak in a pipeline resulted in a major oil spill. Containment and repair were hindered by community disturbance and the situation was worsed by the outbreak of a fire, source unknown.
A mud engineer trapped his finger when trying to assist the positioning of a water tank by crane - the lifting crew had been unaware of the location of the Mud Engineer during the lift.
An electrical power loss cause the plant unit to be tripped. The wet gas pressure went high followed by fuel gas Boil Off Gas (BOG) compressors seal gas pressure high - alarm activated.
During a major shutdown, contractors opened the manway door of a reaction vessel. The contractors had been advised that the pressure inside the reactor had been reduced to a safe level.
During the process of lowering a fire extinguisher (6 Kg weight) using a canvas bag and rope, the bag snagged tipping the extinguisher out. The extinguisher fell approximately 8 metres.
One contractor was hospitalised with a broken leg and another treated and released with a broken arm when a steel plate was dropped while mud was being cleaned from bottom of the plate.
Scaffolding equipment fell from the roof of a building due to stormy weather. The scaffolding equipment hit cars parked below. The scaffolding is in place due to renovation of the roof.
The piston rod of the B1 compressor was broken. The screws of the cylinder-head roof expanded. Personnel due to hearing the noise stopped the engine. The automatic shutdown didn't work.
During drilling operations at a well, a couple of pipes were being lifted when the travelling block hit a cornice of the derrick and a wooden block fell off and hit a worker on the head.
A BOP was being lifted using a fork lift truck. As it was lowered, the loop string was detached from the forks and the BOP toppled over striking the IP who was supervising the operation.
A company vehicle was going towards a well on a gravelled road. All of a sudden the the vehicle went off the road to the left and rolled over in loose sand. No injuries to any occupants.
An electrician, employee of a subcontractor had electric shock while he was maintaining the outer security system. He was carried to the hospital. After medical examination he went home.
During PM by contractor, two CO2 cylinders on DG-A were found to be weighing 100 and 87 kg. Two cylinders from DG-B were found weighing 104kg and 105kg. Full cylinder should weigh 120Kg.
The victim, a labourer, had his fingers amputated when his hand was caught between the roller and the trailer while offloading a spool of electrical cable. He was given a month off work.
During the fill up operation the injured person was hit by a low pressure ball valve on the end of the mud hose which parted. As a result the injured person suffered fractures to the arm.
Loss of control of an exploratory oilwell.  A gas pocket escaped due to the pressure at 500 metres depth, while drilling. Minor environmental and structural damage. No personnel injuries.
There was a build up of smoke in one of the shafts. All personnel were mustered according to plan. The situation was normalized after one hour. No one was injured. Production was stopped.
While picking up a coil of cut off wireline to dispose of in the skip, the loose end of coil sprung and puntured through the glove and penetrated the left hand causing a first aid injury.
During the construction of a water storage tank a worker was killed by an electric discharge because while guiding the hook of a crane its wires came into contact with a high tension line.
Gas bottle rack was being loaded to a boat from an offshore platform. Wave movement crushed the contractor between the gas bottle rack and another 30 ft. container on the back of the boat.
A concrete mixer truck was reversing and the banksman was too slow to indicate to the driver to stop. The banksman•À_s leg was trapped between the Concrete Mixer Bull Bar and concrete wall.
Pin dropped from main hook of crane during operations at height of approximately 20 metres, hitting a person on the elbow. The injured person was taken to hospital for medical examination.
The rig mast was being lowered. The fitting on the hydraulic system failed causing loss of pressure in the lowering ram. The second ram could not support the mast which fell to the ground.
Two contractors were working on road maintenance and while preparing road signs (with fire) they were accidentally burned.  Both were hospitalised for first, second and third degree burns.
A contractor's supply vessel ran out of fuel while working near the production platform.  The vessel dropped anchor to prevent further drifting but the anchor failed to hold grip on seabed.
A helicopter started to lift-off an offshore platform deck while two persons were nearby (not boarded yet). The helicopter reached a height of 1.5 meters  before re-landing to pick them up.
A worker received an electric shock to his right forearm while conducting work on a generator.  The worker experienced some tingling and numbness but suffered no injury from the incident.
During disconnection of the loading arm, after uncoupling the loading arm from the ship manifold, the loading arm targeting cable failed. The situation was controlled by on scene operators.
During upgrade of a refrigeration plant knock out drum, high levels of mercury were identified in the vessel. Full decontamination practices were employed to manage the contamination found.
Vessel was in the process of mooring alongside the quay. The Captain reporting seeing a person who jumped onboard deck before the gangway was secure and access granted to board the vessel.
While erecting scaffolding, the injured person stepped off a partially erected scaffold and put his foot on a protruding scaffold board on the floor and slipped, sustaining an ankle injury.
While involved in a cleaning operation, a worker fell through an open access manhole, catching his lower abdomen on the deck edge of the access resulting in fracture & damage to spleen.
A terminal Dolphin in Caribito river was being demolished, the platform  where the debris were being put, failed down, resulting the foreman, who worked on the platform, struck by the debris
Employee of contracting well working team drove a truck to the job site.  When he was overtaking 3 cars it collided with another car coming from the opposite direction and killed the driver.
When a beehive was disturbed the bees attacked the swamp buggy. Four men jumped overboard to escape the bees. Three of the men were picked up by a speedboat later but the fourth man drowned.
An operator was struck on the head by a fire insulation hatch which fell while he was working with it. The hatch weighed 62 kg. He was sent to hospital  but they did not find anything wrong.
While offloading a supply vessel at night, a large swell caused an Able Bodied Seaman to be swept overboard into the sea.  He was wearing a lifejacket and was rescued in less than 5 minutes.
Accident occurred while trailer driver was reversing as the labourer was attempting to get down from the top of trailer where he lost his balance and fell down beneath the rear tractor wheel.
Contractor twin-cabin van collided with third party vehicle resulting in the death of 4 men.  Also, 1 3P & 1 other contractor(LTI) sustained sever injuries and another 3P slight injuries.
When an operator started up the compressor a gas accumulation appeared immediately and ignited, reaching the worker who died.  This accident was due to the violation of operational proceures.
A contractor driver was driving along when a front tyre blew off causing the driver to lose control of his vehicle.  The vehicle rolled over and the driver was sent to hospital for treatment.
A gas release was observed during the restart of a platform following a planned shutdown. The platform was immediately shut down and de-pressured. No personnel were injured during this event.
Operator was manually closing a 25mm steam bypass valve when the bonnet failed resulting in a steam release and the ejection of the stem and handle. The operator did not receive any injuries.
The operation was shut down and all employees and neighbouring communities evacuated by air.  The resultant local communal clashes lead to the loss of about 140,000 bbl/d production to date.
While returning from field operation a bus transporting the seismic drill crews slipped off the main track into a paddy field, a drop of approximately 2 feet, flipping the bus onto its side.
Whilst doing safety checks on H2S monitoring equipment it was identified that 4 Escape Breathing Apparatus sets on the drill floor, had the valves wound right out and the bottles where empty.
Failure of crane pin bolts leading to crane boom falling over side K-1 working barge subsequently one diver was killed by depressurised condition when he tried to come back to surface himself.
While annual switch-gear maintenance was being performed, a person entered a cubicle that was apparently live with 4000+ volts.  The person apparently came into contact with the circuit.
A contractor's headscarf became tangled in the starter pulley of the compactor.  He fell, hit head and became unconscious. The scarf tightened on the pulley and began to strangle the casualty.
A small gas leak from the new well up-stream  manifold isolation valve was discovered after the completion of a pressure test of this flow line.  No leak was detected during the pressure test.
During back up hydraulic system testing on port side crane, crane boom fell on cantilever. There were no injured persons, and the damage that occurred during the fall will be determined later.
IP was maintaining the iron roughneck on the drill floor when he caused it to move resulting in his right leg becoming caught between the frame of the iron roughneck and an adjacent stanchion.
While coiled tubing frame with flow head attached was being lifted into the derrick the guard protecting the tugger became caught up, the securing bolts sheared and it fell to the drill floor.
While transferring HCl acid from open top tank truck, the driver from the truck was exposed to acid fumes.  The relief driver was cautioned about escaping fumes but was still exposed to fumes.
A painter was hit from behind by a 7-tonne forklift. He suffered a fracture at the fibula of his left leg and a minor fracture at his right pelvic bone. The incident recorded 30 days lost time.
An associate was walking past a portable freon recovery unit, when he bumped the discharge valve with his knee.  Freon escaped soaking his clothing.  First degree burn to inside of right thigh.
During PM by contractor, two CO2 cylinders on DG-B were found to be empty. They are weighing 97 kg. Two cylinders from DG-A were found weighing 110kg and 106kg. Full cylinder should weigh 120Kg
When lifting a material container from a supply boat, the door of the container dropped to the boat deck.  Potential for serious or fatal injury to someone who may have been near the container.
5 gas detectors activated at jetty due to inadvertent release of trapped LNG inventory between MOV and HV for loading arms B & D, vapourised to atmosphere. Approximately 1m3 of LNG released.
During the flushing of a cement line the pressure became too high in the hose. The operator lost control and the hose could have hit the operator. The operator was covered with cement and water.
There was a leakage from a mud hose, 30 cm below the fastening point to the Top drive. The mud hose broke and fell down 33 metres to the drilling deck. One person was nearly hit by the mud hose.
Inbound helicopter, carrying no passengers, crashed whilst in a holding pattern, waiting to land.  No mechanical or other problems had been mentioned whilst in contact with the flight dispatcher.
A waste water tanker went off the road and tipped over onto its side. As a result of the accident, the driver's assistant sustained a shoulder dislocation and waste water spilled onto the ground.
A worker suffered back strain while working on the drill floor.  He was changing load cell on pipe tong when he felt a pain in his back.  He was not lifting or carrying any equipment at the time.
An adjustable spanner fell from 20 meters onto the drilling floor. One person was working nearby and was hit on the leg by the adjustable spanner.  He received first aid treatment from the nurse.
During a tank filling operation, the crude oil level had exceeded the maximum allowable operating level limit. It caused damage to foam nozzles, rim seal and disturbance to the UV fire monitors.
The driver lost control his Mitsubishi unit and rolled over into the ditch. The right front tyre was deflated due to skidding action. The driver sustained minor injuries and was sent to Khartoum
While the rig •À__rigged-up from the previous day- was being set up, the second section of the derrick came down producing the travelling block to fall on the work floor. No injuries were recorded.
While the Contractor employee was tightening the compressor bolt at 20 meters above-ground with the helper man-basket, accidentally the basket came down fast and its angle hit the employee's face.
Raising a posytrack the equipment structure made contact with an electrical line (2400 volts). The drilling operator stepped down from the truck touching the ground and receiving an electric shock.
The victim together with 2 others were erecting a radio antenna for the seismic base camp. The pole touched a 6KV overhead power line electrocuting the victim fatally and injuring one of his mates.
Dive Support Vessel (DSV) suffered a loss of position keeping whilst operating in Dynamic Positioning (DP) mode, while diving was underway, i.e., there was a diver in the water who was put at risk.
Driving towards the rig site in the hours of darkness, the vehicle swerved to avoid a buffalo and the driver lost control of the vehicle as the vehicle left the road and rolled over several times.
The victim, an electrician, was descending a ladder when he caught his foot between the rungs and injured his left arm. He had been repairing a defective light bulb. He was given two days off work.
A contractor was removing the bolts on a piping spool / flange section.  Trapped pressure between the closed valve and the check valve released, spraying emulsion in his facial area and upper torso.
A home made non-certified attachment fitted to a pencil grinder caused vibration and the under rated cutting disk (13,000 rpm used at 30,000 rpm) shattered and fragments struck the man in both eyes.
A Swing gate across a cattle guard was left partially closed.  A pipe from the gate struck the front of the pickup and entered cab, impailing the driver then exiting out through the back of the cab.
During a tank gauging, the IP lost control of the tape. Instinctively he grabbed for the handle, which hit knuckle of his right hand and his little finger. The IP's finger was found to be fractured.
Early in the morning of August 27, 2011 a contracted bus, transporting company employees over night on a long route, crashed into an oncoming truck while overtaking a horse carriage on a blind bend.
Helideck Foam tank Nitrogen bottle supply hose (1 of 5) catastrophically failed resulting in a sudden release of bottle pressure. Metal fragments from the hose were scattered across the weatherdeck.
On March 17, 2010 around 1330 hours, a recording cable pick-up vehicle flipped over on its side at a road bend on black top road. The driver suffered minor abrasions to his left cheek, arm and leg.
During a rapid descent of a drilling conductor the pipe was suddenly stopped by the secondary block of the crane causing a structural member to fail under stress being released and hitting the worker

Helicopter crash. The victim may have deployed the floatation device too soon before the crash. His companions were unable to release the victim•À_•À_s seat belt which may have been fastened incorrectly.
When the contractor bus started to cross the road the driver lost control and the bus hit two people who were on route to work.  One person succumbed to his injuries on arrival at the medical centre.
A contractor driver of a gravel truck was travelling at high speed when he came across some cattle in the road.  The driver lost control of his vehicle and hit the herd causing damage to the vehicle.
A gas release occurred in the Acid Gas Injection unit when a 3" valve was being removed. There was potentially 24% H2S in the gas and operator was on the platform without wearing Breathing Apparatus.
At 1430H during loading of SRU 2 structures from the adjacent open space of FZ24B to the truck trailer using crane with HWP 12630, structure I-beam (0.8m) fell to the open ditch from 4 meters height.
Two contractors were attempting to move a 3 inch bridle line off sub and A-leg. The slack came out of the bridle and struck the employees. One person was hospitalised for face reconstructive surgery.
While executing soil movement with a caterpillar, the machine became  tilted towards the side risking a roll over. The operator decided to jump to the ground and suffered an ankle injury as a result.

A tack-welded temporary bracing (steel pipe 7.8 m in length, weighing about 1.5 MT) fell off a height of about 4.5 feet.  It landed on a Fitter Helper working underneath it, pinning him to the ground.

A temporary employee climbed an electric power pole to carry out maintenance work. He slipped and fell from a height of about 5 meters. He was not wearing a safety harness. He died from a broken neck.

Crude oil overflowed the platform drain system , fell to the sea below and was ignited by falling welding sparks.  The fire spread  to the upper levels of the platform and production office facilites.

Employee of contracting well working team was working to pull out tubing from production well.  Power tong was in position but somehow became loose, kicked back and its handle hit the employee's head.

Vehicle got stuck in wadi and water level rose rapidly.  Driver escaped but passenger unable to get out of vehicle on time.  He drowned and his body was recovered 2 days later when wadi was again dry.

A 3 ft basket (open equipment container), weighing 1600 kg, developed an abnormal pendulum and an operator was hit. He was hit in the upper part of his body. He was also forced against some equipment.

A 620ft bulk carrier vessel weighing 50,000 metric tons passed an unsafe distance from an offshore installation facility, with no resultant activation of the offshore facility emergency response plan.
During maintenance activities inside of a crude storage tank (sand blasting / painting) a contractor was seriously injured after the scaffolding collapsed. Back injury, possible permanent incapacity.

During the installation of a 26" conductor on a RC-% well slot, through grinding and welding, there was a flash fire leading to minor burns to the production engineer due to the presence of crude oil.
Furnace fire caused 2 employee lost time injuries.  One employee suffered fractures, 2nd and 1st degree burns on hands, face and legs, partial teal of ligament and meniscus to knee and lung problems.

Contract crane operator fell through hatch of deck platform.  When trying to relese sling operator slipped off stacked material and fell through open loading hatch (more than 10 metres) to cellar deck.

While performing work on compressors located in the middle floor of the rig the worker took a shortcut across an inclined beam. He lost his footing and fell 30ft striking a 2" guard rail half way down.

A 1 ton sling parted under tension, whilst being used with a tugger to try and pull free a Kelly hose that had become caught in a joint of riser being lifted onto the rig floor. No injury to personnel.

A crane block weighing 1T was dropped 100 ft onto accommodation after it was raised into sheaves, snapping the crane wire. Limit switches were not working and an untrained operator was using the crane.

A joint of liner being made up by the Contractor casing crew was bent when the blocks unexpectedly descended. The block's descent was stopped by the driller who actuated the emergency draw works brake.

A junior contractor warehouseman was dismantling shelving brackets when the shelf collapsed.  Some drilling wiper plugs fell onto him.  He was taken to the doctor for assessment and was given time off.

Collision between a fishing boat and an offshore platform. There was nobody at the wheel of the boat at the time of the collision. Minor damage to platform but it was not very far from a "live" riser.

During a BOP high pressure test of the choke and kill lines, the test pressure of 10,000 was lost and the test tool weighing 900kg toppled free of the riser adapter and dropped 11.5m to the deck below.

During the routine cool-down of an LNG carrier, the "A" loading arm parted from the manifold at the emergency release coupling resulting in release of LNG and cold burns injuries to a ships crewmember.

When workers were performing operations to increase the spread on a flange in preparation for hydro blasting there was a release of H2S. All of the workers involved in the operations lost consciousness.

While circulating out the tubing-casing annulus, the transfer pump ignited crude oil leading to a fire on the shakers and reserve tanks. One person was seriously injured with multiple burns on his body.

A 10 meter long perforating gun, still in the riser, went off while it was partially below and partially on the rig floor. Nobody was injured during this incident and material damage is relatively small.

A 3rd Party was hospitalised with laceration and fracture to right forearm sustained while the crew was loading scrap metal onto a trailer when a section of metal struck the crewman on his right forearm.

A fire on both fixed-roof tanks (5,000 Bls) located at the flow station was initiated when the flammable atmosphere inside the tanks, both being operated without the P-V valves, was ignited by lightning.

A rigger working on the top of the ablution block loaded on the trailer truck with full body harness, but not tied-off to anchor points. The rigger was standing at a height of 5.5m from the ground level.

During a well abandonment procedure a gas release occurred while attempting to open a 2 inch casing valve.  The ignition and fire fatally injured the contract employee who had fallen into the well cellar.

Explosion in LQ.  An employee was killed by an explosion which seriously damaged the living quarters.  He was doing ordinary maintenance in a sewage conduit, where there was an undetected build up of gas.

At a fabrication yard, a painter fell from scaffolding while he was doing a touch-up painting. He suffered a broken leg. Taking a short cut and inadequate inspection were the basic causes of the incident.

During anchor handling operations on board tug, the chain used to connect the tugger hook to the wire parted. The injured party was standing on deck and was hit by the wire resulting in cuts and bruising.

During installation on gratings on elevated area, a piece of grating fell down from 2nd level to 1st level platform (6m height). The drop zone on the ground was barricaded and clear of workers underneath.

High swell enveloped the three crew working on boat landing resulting in one crew being washed overboard. The crew member was recovered by supply boat crew with no injury and was returned to the platform.

While preparing a two-legged sling, a coil of wire and master link flipped over causing the master link to slip between the guard rails, dragging the sling arrangement with it down 46 metres into the sea.

The drilling foreman was struck by the derrick as it was being put down from the oil well platform.  A failure in one of the jacks of the machine used for doing the operation was the cause of the accident.

This accident occurred in a gas plant, located on Lake Maracaibo. The operator fell from a 30" pipeline into the lake, when he was walking on it, instead of using the corridor constructed for such purpose.

3 gas detectors activated causing an automatic shutdown in production. The personnel mustered according to plan. Causes of gas leakage: Gas out of 20 mm ventilation on methanol filter nearby gas detectors.

A flow line connecting a producing well to Gas Plant ruptured and resulted in a jet fire at a distance of ~2.5 km from the plant. In response, the line was isolated which resulted in cessation of the fire.

A major crude oil leak from a 16" transit line due to accidental hitting by the excavator while closing the excavation pits. The spill was 360 bbls and the quantity recovered was 285 bbls. Loss is 75 bbls.

Contract worker was hospitalized for a fractured ankle. A group of approximately 10 employees were moving an air compressor when a towing tongue was dropped and released striking the employee on the ankle.

During lifting at ground level for assembly of cooler bundle and fin fan plenum, a contractor employee placed himself in the line of fire to guide a 1/4 inch multiple bend greasing tube through an opening.

During removal of hub from oil flowline for machining of the flange face, the blind hub flew off under pressure and hit individual on shoulder.  He was knocked backwards onto the deck approx 1 metre below.

During work with wireline equipment the wellhead pressure was 39 bar. A valve assembly was broken and 150 litres of fluic with glycol drained out and collected in a closed drain. The area was cordoned-off.

Gas leakage: 6 gas detectors went off in the well area. The situation was soon under control. The mustering was on the life boat station. The leak was in a new pipe flange; the flange was not hydra tighted

The injured party was attempting to troubleshoot a power supply problem, while doing so, the live cables came in contact with each other and caused a flash fire. IP sustained minor burn injury to his palm.

A floorhand was hit by a barrel that had fallen from the rig floor and injured his head and right shoulder. The barrel that ran into the sheave had parted the wire and caused the barrel to fall. (LWD 1 day)

Emission of 60 cubic metres of oil based mud: There was a leakage on the pilot valve. During this operation the lower marine riser package was disconnected - and was lifted 5 metres from BOP on the sea bed.

Minibus carrying seven passengers from terminal to office in Baku hit the edge of pavement resulting in roll over into ditch. Injured passengers were taken to local hospital for examination and observation.

While in the process of welding inside a heat exchanger, a flash fire occurred. 2 welders sustained a first aid injury. The incident had potential to cause fatal injuries to the welders and nearby persons.

While welding on 4•À_•À_ choke line flammable gas was released causing a flash fire that immediately went out. Two workers were in the vicinity and exposed to the fire causing 2nd degree burns to face and neck.

During work over activities the well blew out expelling the pipes hitting the derrick man causing his death instantanously.  The cause of the blow out was associated with unbalance in the hydrostatic column.

A pup joint was supported in the mousehole by a chain-tong. As the elevators were kicked out to lift the pup, the chain tong unseated, the pup joint dropped and the chain tong struck the top of a man's foot.

Coil tubing reel backloaded to the standby vessel using Hasdrubal crane which was reeved for single fall. The lifting plan was recommending a use of twin fall hook as the coil tubing reel load was 18.7 tons.

The subsea operator was hit in the face while working with riser rucker wire. He was sent onshore for treatment but he returned to the platform the next possible day (there was no helicopter at the weekend).

A 215 kg (3.5m long) steel lifting frame (Hoist Beam) was knocked overboard by a swinging crane load of scaffold boards from Offshore Platform top deck; causing damage to lower deck equipment on its way down.

The labourer was accomodating drilling liner tubes, standing on them. He   slipped and fell on the ground being struck by a tube on his head. This event happened in The Furrial product field  in Monagas State.

A contractor sustained head and neck injuries when struck by a pressurised hose he was disconnecting during coiled tubing operations. It is likely that he disconnected the hose prior to relieving the pressure.

A worker suffered a broken nose 2rd degree burn to his face and minor burns to his arm/neck when caught in a flash fire. Work in progress was to remove spent adsorbent from process vessel on offshore platform.

At approximately 06:20hrs, the 100 meter telecommunications tower collapsed taking down with it another 60 meter telecoms tower. The nearby telecoms building were also partly damaged. No injury was sustained.

There was a fire in the M30 area. All production and export was shutdown. The fire was put out by the A/R team. All personnel mustered according to plan and the emergency organization on Sandsli was mobilised.

While attempting to unscrew a 3 inch nipple from an elbow using a pipewrench with an extended handle (using a cheater pipe), the pipe wrench jaws slipped, causing the cheater pipe to strike the worker's chest.

Contractor vehicle overtook a double-cabin pick-up and collided, head-on, with a semi-trailer.  This resulted in 2 instant fatalities and 2 severely injured persons.  A third died on 9 Feb 98 from his injuries.

Norway employee suffered a fatal heart attack shortly after responding to a non-Phillips emergency involving a ship fire.  There were no indications in recent physicals there was a pre-existing heart condition.

A storage tanker at a loading buoy was suddenly exposed to 55 knots of wind broadside. The starboard hawser parted, followed by the portside one and finally the two export hoses failed. Shut down was triggered.

As part of a yearly electrical preventive maintenance, a test has been realized on the flare ignition system using fuel gas through the HP pilot line. An explosion occurs in the air blower of the flare network.

Due to the sudden closure of an 82 inch butterfly valve, the pressure upstream of the valve increased from 5 barg to 8.5 barg. The system incoporates a "spill back" line to protect the system from overpressure.

IP was involved in an RTA while driving to the field. The vehicle was reported to have been hit from the rear, swerving off the road and into a ditch on the opposite side of the road. No injuries were recorded.

The injured person was loading a carton of toilet seats into a Wagon when approximately 40 kgs of the toilet seats fell onto his right leg / foot. He was treated at hospital and was given 11 days off from work.

When a worker connected a steam hose to the vessel they noted the drainage hole was plugged. The worker removed the plug from the drain hole and was then overcome due to a release of sour water from the vessel.

When the Chief Officer tried to move the belting with his right hand, the motor started, dragging his fingers into the pulley groove. As a result, the tip of his index, middle & ring fingers were amputated.

While placing slips in position the worker's middle finger on the right hand was pinched between the slips handle and the elevator. The worker felt pain but continued to work without seeking medical assistance.

While unauthorized mechanical excavating activity was operating nearby Main Entrance check point gate, the excavator scratched alive power cable 400 Volt resulting into power trip for the Building and Premises.

The worker was tied to a security belt attached to the tower's basket.  The tower fell down, the worker dropped to the floor and the basket fell on top o fhim and hit the back of the head, consequently, he died.

A contract welder assistant received an electric shock when a switch was inadvertently activated.  The worker was hospitalized for electric burns on the 5th left hand finger and burns on the left and right legs.

A contractor was sitting in front of a service golf kart during lunch break when another worker sitting in the golf kart accidently pushed the accelerator and the golf kart moved forward striking another worker.

An associate went to sit down in a chair to talk on the phone and it flipped over (chair came apart at the swivel).  He struck his head and neck on the edge of the table behind the desk.  Bruise to back of head.

During the site preparation activities for an onshore terminal, a grader backed into an overhead electrical pylon (33kV). The pylon was damaged, but the power lines remained in place. No injuries were sustained.

During drilling activities an labourer died by electrocution when he opened the main door of accomodating trailer in Barua  production field, Zulia State, The trailer was electrified by an air conditioning device

During the opeing of a valve (10") in gas lift manifold there was a sudden increase in the gas pressure, which cauased a fracture at the level of the flange reduction.  The valve hit the worker causing his death.

The labourer tried to climb on a truck platform. Doing this he slipped and tried to hold on to a pipe laid down on the platform, falling with it to the ground. He was killed by the pipe which hit him on his head.

An employee was making his routine round and was checking on an overhead valve.  While standing on the skid and looking at the valve, he lost his balance and fell sideways on to the deck, injuring his right knee.

Due to noise from a recirculation valve, the platform organisation had to take action to measure vibration and to carry out a frequency analysis to find the under tension the valve and pipe system was exposed to.

Ocean petroleum 161 platform was towed away from offshore location.  At the beginning of towing, the main power generator room was burning. The fire lasted four hours. The direct ecnonmy loss is 480 million RMB.

ROV Technician's finger was caught between the roof of the personel basket and the bottom of the support beam resulting in a top joint amputation and right hand of middle finger and crush injury to fourth finger.

The injured party slipped whilst climbing over a  waist high beam next to the main riding tugger on the drillers' doghouse roof.  He fell back and landed on the edge of the floor grating, injuring his lower back.

While driving back to camp after completing a short shift, the IP lost control of his vehicle on a recently graded gravel road causing his light vehicle to roll over. The vehicle missed a tree by approx 2 metres.

While picking up a joint of tubing using manually engaged elevators on the rig floor, a single joint of tubing came free. The joint fell one foot to the ground and toppled over. One person sustained a leg injury.

Driver of a pick-up truck crossed the centre of the road in the middle of a curve and collided with high-deck trailer of an oncoming tractor-trailer rig.  Cause is considered to be excessive speed by the deceased.

Monitoring corrosion in a discharge line of a gas compression plant the worker was struck by a plug which released due to the high pressure of gas.  The cause of this accident was the use of an inappropriate tool.

While checking out bolt tension with a ring spanner, the index finger of the maintenance personnel was caught between the ring spanner and the bolt. The injured person received first aid prior to medevac to shore.

While preparing the port crane for lifting operations, the starting battery of the crane engine exploded. Due to the impact of the explosion the top of the battery was lost overboard and the battery was destroyed.

A routine Fast Rescue Craft drill was being conducted. On being retrieved from the sea, the lifting frame failed and the boat fell around 18m into the sea. There were 3 crew. One was killed and 2 suffered injuries.

Crew transport vehicle carrying 20 staff left road & overturned.  2 died instantly (driver's cabin), 3 others seriously injured & other 15 sustained light injuries.  Apparent cause = tyre blow-out.  7 LTIs

Two workers in a special basket were being lifted by a crane in order to be placed on a drilling barge deck. Suddenly 1 of the wires broke off causing the workers to all into the Maracaibo Lake. One ofthem drowned.

A 4x4 vehicle was swept off a road by a torrent of flood water and carried approximately fifty metres downstream. A contractor driver climbed onto the roof of the vehicle and was rescued by civil defence personnel.

A contract employee working on the cable rack fell from the upper platform, while descending a scaffolding ladder. He got stuck in one of the ladder supports and sustained a compound fracture of the upper left leg.

A contractor driver, when operating a URAL-mounted CA-320, moved backwards and ran into a pole of power lines 6kV of the feeder. The incident resulted in the pole breaking and the emergency shut down of the feeder.

A crane was being used to lift a chemical tank from a ship to the platform. When the tank was lifted in the air the tightwire broke and the tank fell to the deck of the ship. It caused a shipman's leg to be broken.

A scaffolder was erecting scaffold near an open flange of a line that was under nitrogen purge. The purge gas had displaced the oxygen in the immediate vicinity of the flange causing the scaffolder to become dizzy.

Contractor security guard was found dead inside an oil saver tank.  The position of the body indicated that he may have fallen backwards whilst descending a ladder.  Autopsy indicates ingestion of hydrocarbon fumes.

The driver of a contractor vehicle braked to avoid running into the truck in front. He skidded and crossed into the opposite lane, colliding head-on with a saloon car carrying 3 passengers, the driver of which died.

Transporting materials for being used in seismographic operations, a helicopter, crashed against "La Teta" Mountain in San Pedro - Macohango,  Zulia State; in this accident the pilot died due to multiple fractures

A 20 ounce (.6 kilogram) hammer was left on top of a joint of riser pipe after it was prepared for lifting.   This created a potential •À_•À_Dropped Object•À_•À_ event for personnel onboard the vessel and the drilling rig.

A contractor was running in tubing at well R-115 of the field when, at 14:10, the tubing collar parted and remained in the elevator. Broken tubing damaged the hoisting tackle of the APRS-50 WO rig. No one was hurt.

At approximately 10:46 hrs at the Shorebase, whilst carrying out back loading operations on the main boat, the vessel boat, whilst manoeuvring to dock further down the quayside, came into contact with the main boat.

During routine brucker transfer operations, a maintenance employee, standing on brucker, fell to sea after the winch spelter 'parted', allowing the brucker to fall.  Incident resulted in a LTI - 141 days to y-e 2000

When a contractor was putting tools away into the toolbox, the cover of the toolbox was blown shut by the wind. His left forefinger became trapped and he sustained an open wound.  Medical treatment recordable NLTA.

While drill crew was swapping over mud hose from standpipe # 2 onto standpipe #1 outlet, an aprox. 7kg sledge hammer head seperated from the handle and dropped aprox. 94 feet from derrick landing on the drill floor.

A crane operator was struck by the arm of the crane, when it fell down because of a welding failure locate dat the point where the arm joins the cabin. The operator lost one of his arms as a consequence of the impact

Contractor driver, on unofficial business, overturned vehicle by speeding over speed-breaker.  He survived but his passenger, who was not wearing a seatbelt, was ejected from the vehicle and sustained fatal injuries.

Loaded road tanker was hit by rice truck travelling in opposite direction.  Passenger in rice truck was killed instantly.  Others released from hospital after check-up.   Rice truck had moved onto wrong side of road.

A deck hand was injured while back loading the 36" casing. He slipped and his foot was caught under the joint casing when it was set down. He was sent to shore for x-rays. His foot was cut and bruised but not broken.

The loading arm D went to free wheel mode while the operator was parking it. Consequently the outboard arm moved down suddenly and hit the jetty head floor and handrail. No injury reported, only minor material damage

Whilst pulling out of a hole as the derrick man unlatched the elevator, one of the "Horns" broke off and fell approximately 82 feet to the drill floor deck.  No personnel injuries or equipment damages were sustained.

A near miss incident occurred in deepwater drilling operations when BOPs (blowout preventers) were unlatched from a well head and Marine Riser Tension (MRT) cables were disconnected to begin pulling the riser and BOP.

An operator was lifted 2 metres during the rig up of a casing tong when the draw works were started with the sandline clutch engaged. The operator was standing on the tongs attaching data leads to complete the rig up.

The fuel tanker driver was speeding when he approached a left hand curve on the road; he manoeuvred further to the right hand side when the vehicles wheels went off the gypsum onto soft sand resulting in the rollover.

Heavy seas stove in the wheelhouse window of the vessel "Seaboard Supreme".  The force of the water threw the second mate against the chart table and he sustained severe injuries from which he later died on 16th March.

Subsea engineer was lubricating the •À_•À_o•À_•À_ ring in a H-4 connector when the bridge crane holding the H-4 connector failed and caused the connector to swing and trap the employee between the connector and the test stump.

A car travelling along the main road from Marib to Safir attempted to overtake another car when it lost control and veered off the road to the left side. It swerved back to the right and rolled over onto sandy ground.

A contractor was doing operations on construction of oil pipeline. The pipelayer operator was doing piping assembly and while driving under 6kV high-voltage line the pipelayer touched and broke a high-voltage wire 6kV.

During welding of a crack formation in the injection compressor  there was a minor explosion. Before welding started there had been no sign of gas. The personnel who was inside the habitat suffered some minor injuries.

Safety pin shears allowing Crane Boom pennant securing pin to work loose. This could still have resulted in a catastrophic boom failure should sufficient weight being lifted at the time of pin coming free from pennant.

The injured broke his arm and injured his head, face and right leg when he lost his balance and fell down from 7-8 meters height. He was attempting to release the block dead line that was hindered by a pin. (LWD 1 day)

While transporting fill dirt, the scraper that the contractor was operating left the dirt roadway and rolled down a 50ft embankment.  The contractor suffered internal injuries and was pronounced dead a short time later.

A contractor assistant driller sustained some burns on his face and right eye after being hit with some hot oil.  He was treated at the site clinic and then referred to the hospital.  He was given time off for recovery.

A heavy thunderstorm caused lightning to strike a 30m radio antenna pole causing damage to station walky-talky with 12V DC power supply, telephone PABX and satelite links, anunciator, fixed H2S monitors and fax machine.

While a motorhand was installing grates on the drill floor, the grating that weighed approximately 34 pounds shifted and fell approximately 13 feet through an opening into the cellar/ substructure. No injuries reported.

The victim fell through the slot where grating had been removed and landed on well protector slots at the +15 level.  He was conscious and aided to comfort.  Lost consciousness and declared deceased upon arrival to Soyo.

A metallurgical failure of the draw works electromagnetic brake spline ring occurred resulting in the blocks and elevators falling to the rig floor.  The saver sub also hit the tool joint of the pipe in the rotary table.

Construction crew was repairing a cement bucket that ran on a rail. While pushing the bucket, his trousers became caught on an elevator roller which, still running, rolled his trousers.  He struck his thigh when he fell.

During installation of the Pipe Line End Termination (PLET) on the well an explosion occurred which resulted in injury to 3 personnel and to extensive damage to the PLET and its Corrosion Erosion Monitoring (CEM) System.

Refrigeration Technician received electric shock when his hand came in contact with the TRAM HVAC system in a unit compressor with hot gas solenoid. 215 V AC Shock to right hand occurred but there was no physical injury.

While trying to secure a tubing hanger in the well head, the hanger came out of the top of the BOP and fell to the ground. The well was immediately secured by closing the BOPs and casing valve. No injuries were reported.

A boat-master preparing to transfer from a drilling platform to his standby vessel was swept from the platform•À_•À_s boat-landing by a large wave. He was recovered to the boat but attempts at resuscitation were unsuccessful.

A Gas Operations Off-Plot crew vehicle driven by driver collided with a vehicle near clinic on road. The accident resulted in left hand fracture injury to an employee in the vehicle and minor damages to both the vehicles.

A helicopter with 3 people aboard landed on a closed helideck.  The helideck was located on a producing platform and was closed due to the jackup drilling rig being cantilevered over the platform and part of the helideck.

Gas bubbles were noticed on the sea surface adjacent to an offshore wellhead platform. ROV survey showed that the 14" sealine had suffered corrosion at the second anode where the welding support was attached to the anode.

Installation of a submersible centrifugal pump was being carried out by two Contractors. While dismantling the deflection roller (electrical cable duct) it fell towards the windbreak on the rig floor and injured a worker.

An LPG tanker (87m long, 12 knots) sailed within 100-200m of a jack-up drilling rig that was on a wellhead platform. Attempts to contact the tanker by radio were not acknowledged until after it had sailed past the jack-up.

An oil and gas leakage occurred because a drainage connecting piece came away from the line between the 1st and 2nd oil separator. A manifold block  (26 kg) fell 4 metres. Approx 50 litres of oil was discharged to the sea.

The person's finger was injured when it became trapped between moving pipework being installed and the fixed pipe. The injured person was medivaced on an unscheduled flight for surgery and a pin was placed into his finger.

A contractor was climbing onto the front of the coil tubing trailer to oil the tubing. When he placed his hand between the frame and moving coil tubing reel, his left-middle finger was fractured and his nail was pulled off.

Contractor suddenly put his head inside filter house clean side manway. No confined space certificate was issued. The entry point had a warning sign and was barricaded with red tape. He was immediately stopped and mentored.

Driver and passenger were travelling in a light vehicle when it veered to the left, losing traction on the soft shoulder of the road resulting in the vehicle striking a culvert and rolling over onto the roof of the vehicle.

Following production tests an uncontrolled ignition source ignited flammable vapours from an oil storage tank vent hatch resulting in a flash fire and serious burns to the operator at the top of a ladder who was inspecting.

Stand of 2 7/8 inch drill pipe slipped through elevators and struck a floorman resulting in a possible fracture of his right foot. The stand of pipe was approx 25ft above the rig floor when it slipped through the elevators.

The Tool Pusher attempted to remove the chain tong after tightening a leaking connection using chain tong on an offshore platform. During that time, he slipped and fell down onto the cellar deck from a height of 5.5 metres.

The victim received burns on his right arm when he was attempting to change the circuit breaker. The two lines of electrical cable he was holding contacted each other and caused the big spark. He was given leave for 7 days.

Company police driver stopped vehicle at roadside and opened door.  A motorcyclist carrying passenger drove into door - both were thrown off and received shoulder and head injuries.  Passenger died 3 hours later in hospital.

A level D process trip was initiated by a high pressure trip in the LP Separator caused by a gas blowby from the test separator.  This incident was a breach of the HP/LP interface and classified as a high potential incident

At about 18:00 hrs an acting Supervisor of the Pump Station was returning from his visit to the well (16km) away. Visibility was poor due to a sand storm. He braked and the car plunged 10 metres off the road and rolled over.

During a work-over operation, a lubricator was lifted from the pipe deck to the rig floor.  The load was put down and the rear leg of the 2-leg attachment was removed in preparation to •À_•À_stab on•À_•À_ in the vertical position.

While working with the basket from the pipe deck to the skid deck the basket began to rotate. The rigger did not stop the rotation with the guide rope. The rigger had to drop the guide rope and then he fell down the ladder.

An excavator operator was carrying out excavation works when the pit wall collapsed and filled in the excavator bucket. A sudden hit to the bucket had caused back pain to the operator. He was given medical leave for two days.

The hook to the drilling deck winch hung up during installation of a clamping plate for a torque wrench on the top drive. When the hook was undone the clamping plate came up with great speed and hit the roughneck in the face.

While preparing concrete floor for carpet covering on 15th floor, a stud protruding from the floor was hammered flush.  In doing so, a piece of concrete fell from the underside of the floor striking a desk on the floor below.

Responding to a call out, an employee was boating to the location.  while manoeuvring the boat across the intercostal waterway, the boat collided with a barge being pushed by a tug.  The employee died from fatal head injuries.

After the final piece of lifting gear was disengaged from a concrete column it started to fall and as it fell hit guy wires of adjacent concrete columns. 3 columns collapsed and 2 were destabilized. No one was hurt or injured.

Contractor was attempting to free a tug line that had hung up. When the line came free the sheaves came loose and struck the employee in the rib cage and elbow. The person was hospitalised for surgery due to a fractured elbow.

Child ran in front of a truck subcontracted to drilling contractor.  Truck was moving rig to Sylhet when accident occurred.  Driver has since been absolved of any wrongdoing and a release signed with the family of the deceased.

A lightening strike created a static discharge on pipe work which ignited gas leaking from instrumentation at flow controllers and flow control valve. Two security guards tried to extinguish the fire and were injured by burns.

A rigger sustained a crush fracture on his left foot when trapped in between rigging sling and 32" pipe during lifting activity. He was referred to the medical Center for further treatment. He was given six weeks medical leave.

On 29th September, 2012, a Helicopter was airborne from Juhu Airport with one additional person (Non Company and not manifested) aboard thereby exceeding the payload limits offered for the said flight to Process Platform (TPP).

While disembarking from the tanker, the Mooring Master was caught between the support vessel boarding platform and the tankers accommodation ladder platform. The Mooring Master sustained a minor crush injury to his right thigh.

A 4-leg construction jack-up barge was being positioned next to a fixed platform. At the 2nd stage pre-load, leg 3 suffered punch through quickly followed by leg 2. Essential personnel onboard were mustered and evacuated safely.

A single man, armed with an automatic weapon, stopped the last three vehicles in a 40 vehicle convoy en route to rig site and demanded money. The drivers were allowed to proceed after handing over the equivalent of •À_27 in cash.

After routine work on sight-glass on a 1. step separator a gas leak occurred. The gas was detected in the module and triggered an automatically shut down. Deluge was activated. The gasket in the sight-glass was not tight enough.

When attempting to remove wear bushing the tugger got caught in the DDM resulting in a sudden release of energy. When the tugger came free it snapped the wear bushing out of the rotary table. No one was injured during the event.

While concreting work at area, a mason was injured with fracture to his right hand when it was caught between the bucket lifting arm and hydraulic cylinder support of a Bobcat. He was treated in hospital with multiple fractures.

While trying to moor a vessel to buoy, heard a cry for help.  Reported manoverboard to motor vessel captain.  The body was recovered 35 minutes later.  The cause for the overboard is unknown.  Winds were 16 mph and seas 5-6 feet.

After releasing the casing hanger seal assembly running tool (CHSART) from the hanger, the CHSART jumped (possibly due to pressure) and fell out of the hanger, striking two floor men. One of the men experienced a fracture injury.

When the victim was walking over the grating cover of the washdown pump hole service, his right leg slipped into the grating hole which caused an open wound to his leg.  The field•À_s doctor then gave him five stitches in his leg.

While bleeding off hydrocarbons from the annulus into the cellar of a well, a flammable gas cloud was ignited by a non-explosion-proof halogen light. Three persons were hurt (two burns, one leg injury) in the resulting explosion.

Contractor was driving pick-up truck on a desert road and ran into the rear of a road grader. Driver & front seat passenger suffered fatal injuries. No autopsy was performed on driver. He either died of seizure or fell asleep.

During welding a fire took place on a platform resulting in an explosive zone.During welding operations of a supporting structure on PF3 near the Separator, a spark from welding ignited a fire at the welding site while unattended.

A consultant was fatally injured when the pick-up vehicle in which he was travelling was in a head-on collision with a third party tipper lorry. Two others in the pick-up were seriously injured. The deceased was wearing a seatbelt.

While works for a new line were ongoing the barge carrying out the civil works damaged a live condensate line resulting in a leak.  The leak was ignited leading to a fire.  A fishing boat (ignition source) was engulfed in the fire.

While works for a new line were ongoing the barge carrying out the civil works damaged a live condensate line resulting in a leak.  The leak was ignited leading to a fire.  A fishing boat (ignition source) was engulfed in the fire.

While works for a new line were ongoing the barge carrying out the civil works damaged a live condensate line resulting in a leak.  The leak was ignited leading to a fire.  A fishing boat (ignition source) was engulfed in the fire.

Bending stand of 5•À_•À_ drill pipe. Unintentional lowering of the travelling block, top-drive collided onto top of stand of 5•À_•À_ drill pipe being made-up on the rig floor, bending the stand (93 feet ~28 m) of 5•À_•À_ drill pipe into a bow.

Casing Running Tool (CRT) backed out an undetermined amount at the crossover on the saver sub connection to the CRT during operations associated with running 9 5/8•À_•À_ casing. This incident presented as a potential •À_Dropped Object'.

During hook-up and commissioning, an instrument technician fell from well head control panel and suffered a fractured right elbow. Inadequate communication and supervision and lack of training were the basic causes of the incident.

During removal of an LNG loading arm following the completion of ship loading, a piece of ice estimated to be 1-2 kgs fell about 13 metres from the apex of the loading arm to the ship•À_s loading platform. No personnel were injured.

While a hole drilling truck was making holes to install electric line poles, when driving under the energized line (13.2 kV) being the rig in a vertical position on top of the truck, the wire cut and one of the electric poles bent.

A contractor crew was welding 6 inch oil pipes next to farm tanks.  The hydrocarbon vapours coming from the tanks were ignited by welding sparks.  The cause of the accident was related to the non existing hot work permit procedures.

A road incident took place near zero point of main access road towards a Site at 11:20 hrs on 28th March, 2012, when a filled water tanker of a local subcontractor rolled over from the soft shoulder of the road (under construction).

During a snubbing operation to install a velocity string in the well it was necessary to close the pipe rams to exchange seal rubbers. Accidentally the blind / shear rams were activated, cutting the tubing. The tubing was at bottom.

Lightning struck a test tank, igniting the gas/air mixture in the tank. The tank exploded and the fire self-extinguished due to the heavy rain. The fire team sent a fire truck, but due to mis-information, went to the wrong location.

Two mechanics were repairing a streamer tensioning unit. While lowering the streamer tensioning unit, the unit suddenly moved. This caused the mechanic•À_s hand to be caught in between the edge of the unit and the platform structure.

A pipe fitter engaged in unauthorised flow-line replacement work fell and sustained multiple head injuries. No evacuation procedure was activated and 2 hours passed before the correct medical help was given. He died later in hospital

During maintenance with a working basket the swivel ball became caught up in the hand rail. A piece of the hand rail fell away. Length of the piece: 1,6 meter, weight: 2 kg. The height: 15 meter. There were personell 5-6 metres away.

Scaffold planking was being landed onto the Wellhead platform using the S3K port-side 40Te crane, when planking slid from the rigging before the load was landed. No personnel injuries resulted from this event. No damage to any asset.

Man overboard after a wave hit the supply vessel and swell came on the deck.  Life buoys were immediately thrown into the water and a net was rigged up near the rescue zone.  The person was recovered within 10 minutes suffering shock.

Tesco Top Drive impacted the stand of 4•À_•À_ drill pipe causing damage to the unit (no damage to drill pipe) due to the Driller not operating the draw works correctly and failing to use the Tesco Camera to identify the potential hazard.

Whilst hammering, the head of the hammer (weight approximately 800g) suddenly became detached from the handle and fell onto the ground from a height of approximately 20 metres. The head of the hammer landed inside the barricaded area.

A well was shut down due to a breakage in a chain cable and a riser hanging  in the water, with wind force 70 knop and wave height of 16 meters. Around 40 of the personnel was evacuated to another platform. They came back the next day.

In the process of walking the frame, the Injured Person  tipped the frame too far and lost control of the frame. The frame fell and struck his left foot on the top part above his boot•À_s steel toe cap, badly injuring the affected area.

When transferring a person from vessel to vessel via the fast rescue craft, the person climbing the ladder on the ship's side lost his grip on his way up the ladder and fell into the water. No person injured and no damage to equipment.

While a contractor crew was lowering wash pipe to the v-door it came loose from the elevator, approximately 25 feet above the rig floor.  The pipe hit the mast and then struck the IP.  The IP was taken to medical for further treatment.

Catastophic rupture of sample cylinder during gas sampling from filter unit at wellhead pressure of 2000 psi causing traumatic amputation of arm and multiple head injuries. Quality control and technician competence contributory factors.

At the time of the incident, the rig was pulling drill pipe out of the well. The Driller and Assistant Driller were in the Driller•À_s console and the whole pipe handling operation was in manual mode as the auto-mode was not functional.

Contract employee on a well service rig was releasing a chain binder on a derrick internal load person.  The employee was struck on the chin and subsequently fell 4 feet to the ground.  Employee hospitalized due to injuries on his chin.

The fire occured while the operator was performing routine checks at the Produced Water Treatment Plant (PWTP) in association with the restart of facilities following a shutdown.  The operator was injured with first/second degree burns.

Replacing tail bearing on beam pumping unit, chain suspending the bearing assembly and pitman arms became unchained, allowing the assembly to fall on worker.  Worker was caught between falling tail bearing assembly & electric motor.

A contractor load handler was struck during deck operations to position a container on the pipe deck. The load handler was momentarily caught between a waste skip and deck area bump bar and reported some back pain following the incident.

The well service crew was pooling the hydraulic bailer out of a hole with the 73 mm tubing. At 10.00, while moving the tubing from the rack post, the tubing slipped from the operator•À_s hands, fell down to his right hand and injured him.

While a mechanic was working inside a Motor Grader engine bay, the operator engaged the ignition switch. The fan blade lacerated the mechanic•À_s right wrist and the back of his right hand. He was then brought to Hospital to have surgery.

While hammering on a union nut in attempt to break connection between a flexible hose connected to the air line, the 1 •À__ •À_•À_ quarter turn ball valve below the union nut broke in 2 pieces, releasing compressed air until line was isolated.

While landing the upper completion/tubing hanger we lost control of the compensator. This resulted in and uncontrolled over-pull of 240 tonns and caused the full weight of the travelling block to be put down on the workover riser system.

A contractor electrician was working on a panel at the hospital.  A power surge caused the panel to burn and explode.  The electrician received significant burns and was thrown 5 metres.  He was treated at the hospital and then medivaced.

Gas to flare from produced water degassing tank. Flare valve was open but the gas failted to ignite. A short time afterwards 4 gas detector detected gas. This resulted in a production shutdown and the personnel mustered according to plan.

ROV crew members were fault finding an electrical issue associated with ROV power distribution system. During this activity, the involved party received and electric shock after he inadvertently accessed the incorrect transformer cabinet.

The main 33kV feeder to the DWD plant tripped instead of the unit breaker. Initial investigation revealed the unit breaker did not open due to a suspected system failure, which led to catastrophic failure and damage to the pump and motor.

Worker stepped on a conductor hole cover (~10kg) and fell but was not hurt. The dislodged cover pivoted and fell through the hole to the deck below (5-6m). The worker did not fall through the hole and no one was working on the deck below.

Puling diverter with a sling attach between the diverter and main block.  A swivel on the main block end of the sling parted under strain and the swivel/shackel/sling assembly struck a floorhand on his hard hat causing fatal head injuries.

On May 2, 2010, at around 1915 hours, at the well site, a moveable work platform overturned when a Company well head operator was descending from it as a result he sustained two minor abrasions on his left shin and one laceration on heel.

The 9-5/8 casings moved forward and hit the driver's cabin while being transported from the shore base to JNPT. Also on a second occasion on the same journey the casings moved backwards and were protruding 4 ft beyond the trailer back end.

The Rig was being set up to lift the carrier so one of the matting boards could be removed. Chains on the Vetco crane parted and load was droped onto matting boards. Legs of the carrier penetrated matting board to depth of approx 8 inches.

While personnel were moving a paravane float another float behind it, which had been left unsecured, fell over. The person involved jumped clear of the falling paravane. Following review - this incident is now considered as High Potential.

A passenger bus, in the service a a contractor company, was intercepted by 2 vehicles and 3 unknown armed individuals.  The bus was fired upon when it did not stop.  The shots resulted in fatal injuries to 1 of the 37 passengers in the bus.

The supervisor was struck by the structure of a derrick when it was being removed from its location.  The working procedure was inadequate because it demanded the supervisor had to be working below the derrick structure during this lifting.

Tank roof tilted, allowing liquid pentane to flow onto the roof and down through the normally open roof drain point. Approximately 50k bbls released into secondary (bundwall) containment. No release of product outside secondary containment.

While performing pressure testing ahead of completion activity, the combined sand and water dump lines system was over pressured to 5000 psi instead of the intended 1800 psi. The pressure was bled off with no injuries and no damage reported.

A gas leakage appeared in a temporary connector in the close drain system at Oseberg field centre. One gas detector in the area registered 30 % LEL and two others registered more than 10 % LEL. The area was gas free after a couple of minutes.

At the drilling camp, a clear plastic hose used as a diesel level "sight glass" on the camp generator diesel supply tank became dislodged and fell to the ground. The pipe acted as a siphon and emptied the contents of the tank (24bbls approx).

Expro personnel heard the hammering sound and observed the Floorhand hammering on the Expro 4•À_•À_ WECO hammer union. The Expro hand told the Floorhand to stop hammering the union because the line was still pressured up to approximately 4500psi.

A contractor worker was hit by a scraper while supervising the construction of a drilling pad. The driver while reversing the scraper did not see the worker. He was hit by the blade and suffered a broken pelvis and died from internal bleeding.

A platform utilized the crane with 16t capacity to lift 6t cargo from the platform to the vessel. When the cargo was 8 meters above the vessel deck, it fell down to the vessel deck. No person was injured. It caused serious damage to the crane.

As the IP was disembarking the vessel via the quay side ladder. The ladder partially pulled out from the wall and struck the IP on the head. The IP loss balance and fell into the harbour. The IP sustained a gash to the head requiring stitches.

During a Coiled Tubing (CT) post frac cleanout activity on the well, as the 1.5•À_•À_ CT was being pulled out of hole, a leak was seen at surface as the nitrified fluid being pumped into the CT string began leaking into the surrounding atmosphere.

During a pulling operation, a contractor was inspecting the pipe (Non Destructive Inspection, NDI). Suddenly an explosion occurred in the well head. The emergency plan was launched and the situation was controlled without further consequences.

During well operations, a tubular fell from a pipe handling unit onto the skid deck where people were making preparations for wireline operations.  The tubular came to rest at an angle of approximately 45 degrees in the wellbay blow out panel.

Transportation van carrying four contract employees collided against a concrete barrier and bridge rail.  Impact of the collision caused one passenger to be thrown across the van and through the window.  This passenger sustained fatal injuries.

Five contractors (three operators and two trainees) received burns at the gas plant after being splashed with 380 degree F. material coming out of the high-pressure gas dehydration vapor vent.  All five contractors received second-degree burns.

Retrieving bridge plug setting tool on line-splice in wire parted. The air-supplied wiper plate at the rotary table was lifted by the wire splice to the top sheave (suspended in the elevators), and it fell to the rig floor when the wire parted.

There was a breakage in an instrument pipe during stalling of methanol causing an accidental emission of 100 litres of methanol. The leakage gave deflection on gas detectors. Production was shutdown and the personnel mustered according to plan.

Two contractors received flash burns to the face and hands from the short circuit of electrical equipment during a phase rotation check at an onshore terminal.  This resulted in 2 lost workday cases, 30 and 14 days unfit for work, respectively.

A pool car being driven without authorisation was involved in an accident with a motorcycle on the ONNA/EKET road. The accident resulted in the death of the motorcyclist and serious injury of his passenger and also injury to the pool car driver.

A bowzer carrying around 60,000 liters of crude oil met an accident. As per initial information, this bowzer got overturned due to saving another bowzer during overtake. No fire reported, however driver got minor scratches on right leg and back.

A floorman was attempting to move a foster tong hanging on the rig fence. He did not realize the control pad had swiped the fence and turned it on while he was moving the tong. His left index and ring fingers were crushed between the tong gears.

After a manual well test using a 20-year old 150 bbl fixed-roof test tank the operator began transferring fluid from the test tank.  The tank collapsed and the transfer pump was immediately shut down. No injuries occurred and no oil was spilled.

At 09:55 a.m., when inspecting the Sputnik gag metering unit, Senior Mechanic Engineer of Oil and Gas Production Shop-1 stumbled over something, his leg got between the Sputnik•À_s frame and the drain pan. As a result, his right ankle was broken.

Contractor was rigging up cascade and gas detection equipment when he crossed a cellar.  He was not aware that a section of grating had been removed and fell.  Injury resulted in 5 stitches to the head, 2 broken ribs and damage to one vertebra.

Rig was performing scheduled rig maintenance in between wells when the vessel suffered a complete loss of power. There was no pipe or equipment in the water at the time of the event. All personnel were accounted for an no injuries were reported.

While moving 5 1/2" drill pipes from pipe rack on the main deck, one drill pipe became unbalanced and rolled towards the Assistant Driller, causing his leg to be caught between two drill pipes. He sustained an open wound with displaced fracture.
