Whilst lifting an SBM hose using ship•À_s crane to the ship's deck the chain attached to the ship•À_s crane hook suddenly broke resulting in the free fall of SBM hose which injured two members of ships crew standing by the manifold for connection.

A contractor helicopter went down in the Gulf of Mexico approx. 2 miles south of SOI SP-70 platform.  The helicopter was making an interfield transfer at the time of the incident. The contract pilot and two SOI employees were aboard the aircraft.

An employee was attempting to slide a lid over a well cellar when he was caught between a sampson post and the horsehead of an operating low profile pumping unit, fatally injuring the employee.  Proper lockout/tagout procedures were not followed.

A rig was being moved from one platform to another. On the final approach to the new location the rig slipped into existing spud-can holes and collided with the south face of the platform causing damage to the hull of the rig and to the platform.

The injured party was erecting scaffolding.  While descending from one level to another, he lost his grip on the scaffold bracing and fell onto the concrete floor 14 feet below.  He sustained a fractured left knee cap and lacerations to the lips.

While returning from a meeting a contractor was forced off the road by an oncoming truck that moved into his traffic lane.  The manoeuvre caused the security inspector's vehicle to flip over and land upside down.  Restricted work duty for 5 days.

A diesel tanker caught fire resulting in the death of 2 tanker attendants. A leak was noticed whilst discharging the product. The supply was stopped and repairs were carried out. The fire started from the pump-engine moments after pumping resumed.

After having completed the disconnection of the steam pipeline from the oil well, the worker came back to the steam injection well in order to wash his hands into a pit containing hot water.  During this action he fell into the pit dying by burns.

A mechanical excavator operator conducted excavation works during construction operations across a live 5.5 kv power line. The excavation permit he was working under recorded that there were no underground power cables within the excavation route.

During a rig move, an empty truck travelling ahead of loaded truck helping it uphill via winch cable line. Cable was too short, Driver reversed to reach bumper, did not release cable. Front driver lost control, causing collision killing 2 workers.

A contractor gauger left a production tank drain valve in the open position. An estimated 259 barrels of fluids (produced water and hydrocarbons) were released to the metal secondary containment ring surrounding the tank. No injuries were reported.

The incident occurred while a new section of 13 metre waterline was being fitted. The line collapsed sending large number of pipes in all directions narrowly missing pipe installation crew who were positioned on the upside of the pipe construction.

Contractor received an electrical shock while inspecting a plug on an energized 480V/100A circuit that he thought had been locked out. After first aid treatment at a local clinic, the contractor was released with a full return to work authorization.

While supervising cement mixing job, a Drilling Supervisor fell down from the batch mixer along with the handrail from a height of 10 feet. He sustained fractures of the cervical spine at two locations and underwent a surgical operation in Hospital.

Strain on nitrogen bottle valve caused it to sheer catastrophically releasing gas under pressure of 300BAR.  Contractor was struck with the force and pushed approximately 4m across the deck hitting a solid engine room vent with strengthening collars.

A Floorman sustained burns to his face, hands, elbows, knee, feet and back. A fire occurred around the mud tank which he was watching while killing a job performed in that well. The fire was put out in about 5 minutes.  The man was taken to Hospital.

At 18.28 a fire alarm went off in the switchboard room . At 18.30 a fire was discovered in the switchboard room. There was a lot of smoke in the room and the smoke had oozed into the CCR. At 18.34 the fire was put out with a CO2 (fire) extinguisher .

Man was using hydraulic torque wrench to remove bolts from crane slipring. Working alone, he held the wrench in his left hand and the remote control in his right. The tool trapped his middle finger against a bolt, severing the top 1cm off his finger.

Pulling tubing from well. Some gas bubbles / oil seen in return fluid. Flow check done - nothing detected. Continued pulling tubing. Well took oil and gas kick. Ignition occurred. Personnel evacuated rig. Significant fire damage to rig and equipment.

3 men were pushing a grounded boat. When it freed off they jumped on board. One lost his grasp and drowned. A 2nd one tried to help him and drowned also. 3rd one tried to help unsuccessfully. First 2 men were found dead by diver one & 2 days after

The Tour pusher removed a bull plug on the koomey unit under maintenance. Plug blown off by pressure trapped in accumulator bank. Tour pusher hit by the plug and fell on deck, where discovered. Noone saw the accident. Victim passed away 6 days later.

This event occurred when a buoy was being lifted for being placed working on a barge in Lake Maracaibo.  The buoy suddenly fell down hitting the worker.  The cause of the accident was an inadequate procedure because the buoy was incorrectly suspended.

A burst of 3rd stage cooler bundle tube of 30-K-510 Compressor occurred. The Operator of Compressor Unit (CU) and Shift Engineer in Control room heard a sound of burst coming from Compressor and saw a gas cloud around the CU. After the burst noise CCR

A contractor bus was on its way loaded with 55 workers when the driver had an acute bout of coughing and he lost control of the vehicle resulting in the bus swerving into a roadside ditch, crossing over it and stopping near a rest shelter. The bus hit

A contractor Condensate bowser, filled with 44000 litres, rolled over while travelling to the Refinery. As a result of the roll over one driver received injuries. The injured person taken to the hospital for necessary treatment. The contractor company

A deckhand from a drilling company climbed up to a pipe rack (drill pipe had already overlapped 8 layers in the rack) to tether crane hook, the pipe came free from the rack and rolled onto his right foot. His foot was crushed by the pipe. LTA 5 days.

A dehydration train (T1) was being brought online after a period of standby to allow another train (T2) to be depressured. This was to facilitate maintenance activities on T2. During restart of the compressor a sudden flaring event occurred, resulting

A employee was driving on the L 47 in the direction of Meppen. For unknown reasons the car came to the left about the roadway middle and collided with an oncoming truck. The vehicle rotated and finally came to a stop at the guard rail. Despite the air

A five gallon bucket (approximately 21 pounds) containing metal electrical components fell through a space between the edge of the Module and scaffolding. Falling approximately fourteen feet, it landed on the threshold of the entry door to the Module.

A rig worker (new hire with approximately 7 years of drilling experience) was disconnecting a line from a pressure washer manifold when he was struck in the mouth/jaw by the metal end of the pressure washer line. The IP was assigned with his mentor to

A road traffic collision occurred involving an employee (driving a project vehicle) and a truck and caravan. The company vehicle came into contact with the side of the truck and caravan that was being towed, coming to a stop in bush land approximately

A rope access team were tasked with removing a length of cable ladder rack near the condensate metering skid. They were working above a scaffold structure. As one of the team members positioned himself to pass down the ladder rack, a 4ft scaffold tube

A security guard was injured at the supply base when a large metal security gate weighing approximately 500kg came away from the gate runners and fell on top of the guard, trapping him underneath. The guard sustained a Compound fracture to their lower

A tipper truck driver heard a sound, like air releasing, coming from his truck. He decided to drive the truck to the store to check the problem. When he reached the building and attempted to stop but the brakes failed. The truck crashed into the store

A truck (a former petrol tanker fitted with longitudinal baffles to prevent forward and aft movement) was hauling water when it overturned whilst negotiating a tight (~98o) right hand turn before coming to rest on its left hand side on the road verge.

An empty suction tank truck was on its way from the waste disposal site back to the base camp. The driver wanted to turn left, because the other street was blocked further on due to the construction of a new plant. The driver reduced speed in order to

An operational team member was about to use a laminator machine. They unplugged two items which were already plugged into an extension unit (a Lifepack 15 and a suction unit) before plugging in the laminator, and using it. After finishing with it they

Assistant Crane Operator was sitting in the Port Aft crane waiting for the helicopter to lift from the helideck, when while the helicopter was lifting from the helideck, he observed a white object come from the top of the accommodation and land on the

At 07:50hrs a Confined Space Permit was signed out for work in #9 Port wing water ballast tank. The workers entered the tank and removed a blind on the ballast water system, and re-installed the elephants foot for reinstatement of the tank. Mechanical

At 19:53, a metal worker that provides rig servicing was planning to move a 200 litre barrel with gear oil with the help of the pipe-layer. While he was strapping the barrel the boom of the pipe layer harshly dropped and the rig servicing metal worker

At a Work-Over Rig, the safety line of the derrick man is fixed on the top of the derrick mast. During lowering of the travelling block, the safety line got caught in it and the derrick man was pulled off the derrick floor (monkey board). The operator

Casing pipes unloading activity was going on with the help of a forklift at the drilling yard. The forklift operator was unloading the pipes very fast and roughly in the pipe rack with the help of the forklift. The forklift operator did not secure the

Construction team were to install a new safety shower as per the drawing and location approved by Engineering. The operations team isolated the safety shower water supply at the battery limits of the Fire Zone where the work was to take place. The PTW

Construction workers were tasked with performing mechanical excavation activities on the Irrigation Project. Constructors performed the excavations under an approved Permit to Work (PTW), which had been issued based on a set of Issued for Construction

Contractor crew was completing housekeeping activities at the one of the units in the gas processing plant. The crew was moving materials which included a 2 inch valve from the elevated platform of reactor to ground level. While preparing to lower the

Dropped Scaffold Tube. Scaffolding construction was being carried out against the outside of the Moon Pool wind wall (aft). A three-man scaffolding team was carrying out this activity, one on the roof and two erecting the scaffold from the first lift.

During a lift of the tubing strings, after about 50 cm a sudden vibration was felt and a loud cracking sound. The mast lock failed for unexplained reasons, thus, the entire load had to be taken by the raising cylinder, which gave in, so the upper pole

During an acid wash job on a well, a liquid/gas mixture was produced to the surface and burned directly in the flare pit. At this time H2S gas was detected by the Early Well Test (EWT) facility inlet manifold detector@20 ppm, some 300 metres away from

During Bottom Hole Assembly (BHA) handling operations on the rig floor, a 5 ton rig floor tugger wire became snagged by the kelly hose clamp as the top drive descended. The tugger had been used just prior to the incident and had been hooked off to its

During derrick lifting operations in rigging up activities, the machinist involved heard a strange noise. He moved closer to the derrick and at that moment the winch chain became loose and struck him on his forearm, producing a fracture to his arm.

During plant start up after Emergency Shut Down, the slug-catcher pressure control valve PCV-01118 was slightly opened to keep the flare lit. However, the valve failed open resulting in a high flow rate of gas directed to the flare. This resulted in a

During POOH with Bottom Hole Assembly (BHA) the first heavy weight drill-pipe (HWDP) stand had been pulled out of the hole and the driller positioned the TDS with elevator above the monkey board level and tilted the elevator towards the stand. Derrick

During routine surveillance, Project HSE Engineer smelled gas odour. After investigation, he discovered that a pipe fitter had cut with a pneumatic grinding machine a live HP flare header line. Portable gas and personal H2S detector were signalling an

During the installation of permanent handrail in a hall by a structural team, a scaffolding beam clamp fell from a grating platform approximately 10 metres high onto the helmet of a structural helper who was at the ground level barricaded area. SIMOPS

During the lifting of twelve light weight steel plates (2m in length x 150mm to 300mm in width) from ground level to vessel work platform at 35 meters elevation, the load shifted during the transfer to the work platform causing the plates to fall into

During the towing and commissioning of a FPSO, an operational test of the Deluge/Foam was being performed. A simulation of fire detection was performed to initiate the fire water pump "A", which was operated at 14 Bars. 4 people were in charge of this

During trials of the crude offloading system, a loading hose was recovered to the vessel partially filled with water and pressured to 3.5Bar. In the final stages of recovery, the end section of the hose (weighing in excess of two tonnes) came over the

Explosion on the motocompressor MK-4. The probable cause is a rupture of the section of pipe at the entrance to the refrigerator of 3rd stage of compression. Parts of refrigerator of adjacent unit have been damaged. Technical team gathered on the same

Gas release on drilling rig during restart of adjacent platform following power failure. Drilling rig vent system had been tied into the platform blow down system. During platform restart, the automated blow down valve (BDV) was bypassed and blow down

In connection with permanent abandonment of wells, return liquids (slop) were delivered from rig to vessel. During transmission of slop, the HC- gas alarm was triggered in the tanks on board the vessel. Gas concentration increased rapidly to over 100%

In order to pave the way for a workover crew to carry out its operational program, at around 1PM a maintenance squad was expected to reach wellsite to dismantle the walking beam as part of 9 tons beam pumping unit. The maintenance squad arrived at the

In the preparation of the rigging, a nylon rope was fitted onto a 5t pulley and pulled up through the travelling trolley eye to lift the pulley up to the trolley eye so that the pulley could be fitted on the trolley bracket. When the pulley got as far

Loss of integrity on a well completion lead to major hydrocarbon release from the conductor annulus. All personnel were evacuated from the platform and the rig. Gas release continued for 54 days, until the well was killed, injecting heavy mud into the

On December 4th during daily activities it was necessary to reposition an air duct on the grillage deck.The crane operator was asked to move the duct from the grillage by the supervisor. The crane operator slewed the crane and positioned the hook over

A contract technician, driving a company owned vehicle departed on a gravel surfaced road at a pipeline crossing and struck a gas injection pipeline. The driver experienced no injuries, and the passenger, another contractor technician, received minor injuries.

A Contractor pick up truck driver with one passenger (Rig Crane Driver) were on the way to Company operations for regular crew change. At about 700 m from the camp the car slid off the road & rolled over several times landing finally on the driver's side.

Five and one half inch drill pipe elevators on top drive system came into contact with monkey board while pulling out of hole resulting in damage to the elevator, control hose, and monkey board. One stand of pipe fell across derrick. No injuries were reported.

Hydrogen sulphide gas released causing the activation of fixed Gas detector which was located around 15 metres away from the leak point. This incident occurred while assigned work party were in the process of reinstalling the channel cover to the Hot Lean/Rich

Team member was testing 240v cables as part of re-terminating a replacement motor. Isolation was existing, half racked out in the test position for DCS function testing by a separate crew. Space heater feed was unknowingly not covered by the existing isolation

Whilst mixing the cement slurry for the 30" Conductor cementation, an over pressurisation event occurred as a result of pumping against a closed valve. Pressure realised was 19,000 psi. This was an overpressure of 17,000 psi above and beyond what was required.

A cooler tube of the gas compressor of a booster turbine cracked at a compressor station. The turbine was stopped automatically by vibrations on the cooler blades (crack directly above them). Cracked tube was plugged the next day and turbine put into operation.

A Floating Production Storage and Offtake•À_s fast rescue craft (FRC) was retrieved to a height of 23 metres above sea level following operational duties. When •À_•À_hoist up•À_•À_ control input was given via the davit controls the FRC commenced an unplanned but gradual

A Gas processing plant experienced a minor explosion and fire within the Acoustic enclosure of Ethane Rich Gas (ERG) Compressor Machinery and the associated Equipment within the shelter. ERG Compressor is a Motor Driven Two Stage Compressor, used intermittently

A maintenance team was exposed to Hydrocarbons and hydrogen sulphide which were released whilst de-blinding a 40" downstream valve. At the time of incident, the double block & bleed valve was in closed position and also blinded while in the valve Inspection

A modification has taken place a number of years ago on the Asset replacing Glycol injection with Methanol without following the MoC process. The modification is a non-compliance against the Mandatory Requirements of the Management of Change and Risk Assessment

A vehicle rollover accident was occurred on access road to a construction site; vehicle was driven by the Construction Lead. He remained safe, as he was wearing seatbelt. Soon after hearing of accident, the Ambulance with Doctor Standby on pipeline construction

An electrician and 3 passengers of a contractor were responding to a power outage when they encountered a sand storm followed by rain.  The driver lost control and turned 360 degrees on the road and rolled into the ditch.  All four occupants sustained injuries.

At 4AM, during tie-in construction activities (between node A & node B) a loud sound was reported from B area. Gas was released from the third party network into our network. A temporary spade was used for the isolation of third party 24•À_•À_ line, but didn•À_t

During the lifting and loading of a test Separator unit at the quayside at the commercial port, Takoradi, a loose metal plate of size 2x3 foot was noticed underneath the unit. The unit was being loaded onto the contractor supply vessel. The unit was immediately

On February 21, 2012, at approximately 3:00pm, a contractor was pulling a wire line perforation tool out of the well using a truck mounted crane. The wire line had developed a strand break causing the strand to "ball up" under the grease head on the lubricator.

While performing housekeeping at a cylinder/sling shed, one of the halon cylinders, which was due for disposal, accidentally discharged its content which caused the cylinder to spin uncontrollably and hit the left foot of the handler. He sustained a broken toe.

Whilst apparently racing with another bus, the deceased collided with a lamp post. The vehicle somersaulted and landed on its roof. The decased was not wearing a seat belt and was projected against the steering wheel and the windscreen thus fracturing his skull.

A Chief Engineer on a supply vessel was on the way out from the accommodation to the forcastle deck when he stepped out from the door to the deck floor, he slipped and fell on deck which was due to slippery floor. He suffered severe pain at his right lower shin.

During a rig down and mobilisation operation, a tank car transporting diesel oil had mechanical problems, went off the road and turned over. The injured driver was rescued by personnel of the ambulance and taken to a Social Security clinic for medical attention.

The workover crew was in the process of abandoning well; sucker rods and down-hole pump were pulled out, BOP, pump and open tanks for filling the well with produced water were installed. Produced water was pumped from the tanks into the well. During circulation,

Checking mud cleaning equipment, the victim stepped up on 55 gallon drum to observe fluid level through small window cut in side.  He fell off drum onto cement pad, rolling reserve pit full of cuttings.  The electric cable was in the circuit and the earth faulty.

A contractor WO crew was performing work on well when, at 22:35, a drilling line (•À_•À_25mm) broke as UPA-60 WO rig was running in tubing (•À_•À_73mm), which fell to the rig floor from a height of 1 metre.  Drilling line was last rewound on 25 Jan 2011. No one was hurt.

A Subcontractor Driver was performing work for a Contractor company under the car lease contract and was driving a Contractor vehicle on the highway and, while readjusting from the acceleration lane, did not give way to a third party vehicle moving simultaneously

At around 7:00am of 2nd July 2014, Heavy vehicle driver was performing unloading of sand•À__material at site location, while unloading•À__sand material from the dump truck. Uneven ground and the left rear wheel sinking caused the dump truck•À__load to become unbalanced

During the installation work for the connection of the new HVAC system to the low voltage swtchboard, the two third party contractors were involved in an incident where one suffered electrical burns to his hands and face and the other suffered from medical shock.

The Performing Authority (and Injured Party) for the task and was issued a permit to split a valve and actuator in-situ. As the last remaining bolt was removed the actuator•À_s stored energy was released allowing the actuator to swing rapidly through approximately

Two workers were in the process of conducting scheduled maintenance on a production tank ground-level man-way. A third individual, a pumper, was completing unrelated tank-gauging activities on top of an adjacent production tank. Based on an initial investigation,

An employee was working alone draining a sight gauge.  A co-worker later found the employee lying on the ground next to a gauge tube.  The co-worker noticed the smell of gas and left the area immediately.  The employee was apparently overcome by hydrogen sulphide.

Workman had finished spinning out drill pipe and was removing his pipe spinner when assistant driller accidentally hit the break out control instead of the drum clutch control. The break out tong knocked the pipe spinner and threw floor man into the drawork guard.

In heavy rain accompanied by strong winds the SC with 2 field operators were checking the external call points. They observed one piece of metal 2 metres x 1 metre that had fallen from the steam turbines hall to the location between two 33 KV step up transformers.

While function testing the horizontal pipe racker, HPR, in preparation for racking drillpipe, the stop block on the end of one of the support arms broke off and fell 35 feet to the deck. The weld between the stop block and the arm failed. The block weighed 166 lb.

The labourer fell onto the floor from the roof beams of a water storage tank in construction (7 meters high). The labourer was installing a steel sheet on the roof beams when the event occurred (he loosened his safety belt to change his position on the roof beams).

The decesed drowned whilst attempting to recover a piece of seismic equipment from a deep mangrove pool. Efforts to locate the body were unsuccessful and it Is assumed that his body was swept under the mangroves by the fast flowing current at the bottom of the pool.

3 gas detectors in the well area were activated. NAS 2.0, without depressuring, was activated automatically. The personell mustered according to plan. The operator who was in the area did not find any gas leak. The gas detecors showed normal  value after 2 to 3 min.

A roustabout was attaching a pump in a shipping box by using 36inch and 48inch pipe wrenches. When completed, one of the crew pulled the cheater from the 36inch pipe wrench, the 48inch pipe wrench slipped hit the other crew face, injuring his right eyebrow and nose.

During the testing of the deluge system it was found that various sections are contaminated with biofilm. Sea cucumbers, shells, crabs and starfish were found. The reason why the system is contaminated is probably that insufficient chlorine was used during jetting.

A diver injured his hand during an underwater operations to install a lift clamp to 24•À_•À_ Jintan pipeline. The clamp, under approx. 3 tonnes tension, jumped and hit the diver•À_s left hand (resulted in fractured bones) while he attempted to place a bolt into the clamp.

After changing the head gasket, contractors attempted to restart the compressor, but it would not start. The contractors decided to change the spark plugs. While the plugs were removed, contractors turned over the engine which caused a spark and ignited a flash fire.

Contractor was carrying out excavation for the under ground flowline portion near RCV at the gathering centre area. Accidentally Backhoe hit the under ground Gas line near to the edge of the excavating pit and suddenly Fire erupted. The Bakhoe was completely damaged.

A contractor driver was driving to the base camp.  At the same time another vehicle that was travelling in the other direction passed him and created a cloud of dust.  The driver could not see through the dust and lost control of his vehicle.  The vehicle rolled over.

During the fabrication of piping on a production site, the pipe slipped off a temporary support and struck a labourer on the left thigh. While the initial medical treatment appeared to be successful, there were follow-up complications and the leg had to be amputated.

While preparing for take off, the aft cross-bar tube of the skid of A6-FLZ helicopter suddenly broke, causing the helicopter to tilt and rest on its aft. The crew immediately shutdown the engines. The 11 passengers and crew safely disembarked without further incident.

The decesed fell into a deep ditch of water. He was recovered from the pool unconscious and given artificial respiration. The deceased did not die from drowning. There were contusions on his face and neck and the autopsy revealed that death was caused by a broken neck.

Individual standing on the outer-walkway of the vessel's bridge, using handrail as a ladder with no fall-arrest equipment. Individual immediately instructed to cease activities and report inside the Bridge. This near miss could have resulted in a fall of 5 metres plus.

Severe gas leakage occurred from the gasket of Regen Gas Heater E-307-01 (Head End) at dehydration skid. Plant Level-1 shutdown was immediately initiated at 0615 hrs. and plant was completely de-pressurised to bring it into the safe condition (leakage/de-pressurization

Installed chaser to anchor. Pendant wire attached to chaser was lowered by cranes, leaving chaser unsupported. Vessel movement resulting from large wave caused victim to lose balance, falling across anchor. Chaser fell over and pinned head and back against anchor shank.

The deceased fell into a deep ditch of water. He was recovered from the pool unconscious and given artificial respiration. The deceased did not die from drowning. There were contusions on his face and neck and the autopsy revealed that death was caused by a broken neck.

A contractor's truck was parked on a slope. When the driver released first gear to start the vehicle, the truck started to run down the slope and it rolled over a tent in which 2 military personnel (third parties) were sleeping. One soldier received minor leg injuries.

Construction personnel were performing gouging work at the Deck extension area at Cellar Deck. Hot debris from the gouging work dropped down to the Sump Deck and caught between the gap which contained a minimal amount of crude. The heat of the fire ignited a small fire.

The injured person was assisting in uncoupling a Barite hose that had become blocked. The hose was still pressurised and, on uncoupling, the pressure was released causing the hose to "whip". The rubber part struck the injured person resulting in a fracture to the wrist.

While pressure testing the choke manifold (at 3000 psi), one welded hammer union connection failed resulting in the hammer union (weighting approximately 3 Kg) being "shot" into the air (60 feet) at high velocity. The hammer union landed back in the choke manifold area.

Whilst stepping down from a digger, a contract operator from a service company in charge of solids control and waste disposal, lost his balance and fell 2ft to the ground.  He used his left hand to minimise the severity of his fall causing a minor fracture of his wrist.

To diagnose and repair a well-communication situation operations were underway to pull a back-pressure valve.  An unexpected pressure release caused both halves of a split insert bowl to be propelled from the rotary.  One of the split halves struck a person in the chest.

An electrical discharge of 34.5 K volts caused severe injuries and burns to a worker who was carrying out construction duties on a post of a high voltage grid. He suffered 2nd degree burns on 60% of his body. The worker survived the incident but had 60 days of lost time.

On 07/07, 6:30 am, oil overflow at the flare resulting in oil spill fire of about 600 m2. Despite a very high potential and impressive burning flames (about 50 m high), no serious impact on human, environment and material was recorded. Production was stopped for 2 days.

A helicopter sustained a ruptured starboard sponson fuel tank whilst refuelling via a pressure feed system on the Helideck. This resulted in Jet A1 fuel draining onto the helideck (1099 litres was pumped into the port sponson). The automatic engine shutdown was initiated.

An employee was driving alone in mountainous area checking on wells.  His vehicle was later found to have rolled-over several times, landing 330 feet away from the roadway.  The weather was clear and dry at time of accident, the exact cause of the accident remains unknown.

During extensive rope access activities, one absailer working on wellhead conductors (spider deck) fell into the sea. The affected party was recovered safely by work colleagues and sustained no resulting injuries or medical issues. There was no direct witness to the event.

Four workers died by burns on a flow station platform in the Maracaibo Lake when this installation was being brought into operation.  The cause of this accident was a vertical pipeline failure by corrosion, which produced a leak of gas that was ignited by an unknown source.

In preparation for the upcoming shooting the A/Compressor Mechanic wanted to open a hatch on the gun deck to help with ventilation in the engine room; mainly in the compressor area.  When both compressors are running, the temperature in the engine room can reach 45 deg C.

The contractor CO2 department was assigned to carry out inspection, testing and Maintenance activity on Gaseous Extinguishing system. After completion of the inspection it was found that the 5 reserve bank CO2 cylinders were empty at ground 80kg instead of a normal of 125kg

Helicopter pilot failed to follow company procedures and attached unweighted straps to the hook, during the short flight the straps came into contact with the tail rotator assembly, which failed and separated from the aircraft. The helicopter crashed andthe pilot was killed.

A person was hit by a loose cover in the aux landing area. Due to strong wind (approx 40 knots) one end of a cover loosened. The cover, weighing approx 30 kg, got a pendulum movement and brushed against the helmet of the injured person, who was sent onshore due to dizziness.

On 14th December, 2007 at about 08:20am, a subcontractor employee was enlarging an anchor hole by using a chock grinder. The chock grinder bit broke, swept over and caught his left knee. The employee sustained a laceration and received 6 stitches (2 internal and 4 external).

The rig crew asked a crane operator to pick the pipe up to put the pipe in a chain. The pipes slid down and hit a crewman's left leg. He was pushed about 5 metres from his original position. His upper left thigh bone was broken. He was sent for further treatment at hospital.

At approximately 1255 hours two fatal injuries occurred as a result of a helicopter crash. The fatalities were incurred when an Astar helicopter rolled off the north side of the heliport while attempting to lift off. The helicopter struck the water in an inverted orientation.

During dismantling of scaffolding the victim was detached from his safety lead for movement.  He fell in the sea.  Despite immediate rescue, the victim could not be recovered alive.  The reasons for his death are not exactly elucidated (cardiac attack when he hit the water?.)

A german fishing boat was on collision course with the platform. The fishing boat did not change course until it was 12 minutes from 500 m safety zone. The traffic control tried to get in touch with the boat without any success. The personell mustering went according to plan.

A rig hand was almost ran over by a D6 dozer because he did not obtain eye contact before crossing behind the equipment. The equipment proceeded to back up and he had to get out of the way leaving his boot in the mud. A muddy location was a contributing factor to this event.

STOP Card raised onboard rig to highlight lack of care taken when slops samples were being taken.  An analysis of the slops revealed a H2S level in excess of 400ppm.  H2S in concentrations in the range of 320-530ppm can lead to pulmonary oedema with the possibility of death.

A contractor crew was dismantling an inactive pipeline, when, at 15:00, an excavator involved in earthwork damaged an active oil pipeline (commissioned in 1994) with its bucket. As a result of the incident, 0.25 tons of oil-water emulsion were spilt over an area of 0.33 ha.

While offloading containers from a supply vessel onto the platform the banksman was out of sight of the crane driver.  The driver slowed down the slew when he saw the banksman but his arm was crushed between the container being loaded and an adjacent container on the platform.

At 9.40 pm, at the end of his shift, the production operator was driving a work vehicle to make an inspection. When he arrived at a crossing he did not stop at the halt sign and collided with another vehicle. The driver had not been using his safety belt and died from the blow.

Two tanks for storing oil production water exploded during remodelling activities. The accident occurred when a welding spark ignited inside the overflow pipelines, hydrocarbon vapours coming from the vapour space of the tanks. Death mostly caused by hot water (77 degree burns).

While travelling from offshore location to another platform on a crewboat, the victim and others in his crew removed their life jackets and fell asleep on the deck of the boat.  Upon arriving at the platform destination it was noted that the victim was missing and presumed dead.

A personnel bus (contractor) returning from the work location went off the road and collided with bushes and trees. This impact resulted in three injured persons (two LWC's) and damage to the vehicle. A full investigation has been carried out. The driver failed the alcohol test.

Contract maintenance crew had finished replacing steam valves and was returning steam to the system when a pipe failed, resulting in a release of high pressure steam. A contract employee directly in front of the release received serious burns over a large portion of their body.

Sour crude oil overflow from HP stack flare line due to process upset. Header Valves were manually closed, which resulted in a crude oil leak from the pipeline flange joints in the separator area. A minor fire broke out due to the splashing of crude oil on the dresser couplings.

The scaffolding tipped over and the scaffolding fell over a person. He had pain in his chest and the symptoms indicated that he also suffered a concussion. He was sent to the hospital by helicopter. The hospital did not find any damage. He was staying at the hospital over night.

Rig was offloading 7 inch casings.  A prebundled 7 inch casing swung over helideck.  Crane operator boomed up to raise the load.  The load bumped into the crane boom and one end of the casing fell striking victim's head.  It was the first day of the crane operator on a MODU.

The contract employee was a night watchman and normally watched equipment at night when construction operations were suspended. On this particular evening a critical highway and road crossing was being made. The watchman was struck by a truck while attempting to cross the street.

Asset driller was using a pry bar to slide Drilquip split bushing for casing from the deck of the BOP carrier. As he was sliding the bushing with the pry bar he felt a sharp pain in his lower back. A specialist examination revealed a pre-existing injury. Sent to rest for 4 weeks.

Powerline workers repositioning the security light were unable to rotate the fixtures. Another worker joined in the bucket to help. They heard something cracking and tried to lower the bucket. The bucket tilted and one of the powerline workers fell 16 feet down to ground (grass).

During corer deployment, the hanging frame of a sheave failed and parted resulting in the line that was running through the sheave falling out and coming into contact with a worker below.  The worker sustained a minor injury to his right arm that resulted in swelling and bruising.

Mud logger was travelling to drilling location to relieve another mud logger and was involved in a head-on collision when an oncoming vehicle strayed into the mud logger's path.  The highway was gravelled and very dusty.  Mud logger was pronounced dead at the scene of the accident.

A contractor electrician opened the lighting power DB in the morning to carry out the balance electrical job. Upon opening the power inlet side of the panel he identified that part of the panel was live. He immediately closed the cover and communicated the problem to his Engineer.

A machinist was machining an ESP shaft at the shop. He tried to clean the shaft with his hand wearing a glove designed to be used by mechanics not machinists. The glove stuck to the shaft and rotated with his finger, cutting off the middle finger and little finger of his left hand.

A contract employee working on a well servicing rig crushed his finger when he placed his hand on a hydraulic cylinder that was engaged.  The employee was hospitalized for treatment. The tip of the employee's left ring finger was amputated between the fingernail and the first joint.

Rig crew moving the rig attempted to release the substructure using a rig traveling block and Crane. A Tool Pusher signaled to extend the crane boom.  The traveling block hit the end of the boom, broke the line, fell and hit the left leg of the floorman working underneath the crane.

Production Electrical Technician suffered flash burns to face, neck, ears & hands when operating a circuit breaker.  Likely causes: unauthorised opening of circuit breaker front panel and operating the under voltage relay with a non-proprietary tool to allow the breaker to close.

The pumping unit was being moved to the edge of a site.  Strong winds caused the unit to move to the side of the truck.  The right rear tyres were on a soft spot and as the weight shifted to the side of the truck, the ground gave way beneath the tyres.  Driver could have been killed.

The transport pool driver (the contractor) left Abu Dhabi with passengers for to the rig. Once he dropped the passengers, he left the Rig back to specific area, he lost control of the vehicle and the vehicle rolled over. He was taken to the clinic and then transferred to the Hospital.

There was a gas alarm and a shutdown in production. The deluge was released and there was a depressurization. The personell mustered according to the safety plan. They went through M91 and M92 after the deluge was stopped and depressuriztation was over.  There was no gas in the module

The labourer fell onto the hand rail ladder to access an oil well platform in Lake Maracaibo.  The event occurred during the connection of the flow line to the well.  The labourer was doing this operation when suddenly he lost balance and fell off the work platform where he was working.

A driver was on his way to collect marine terminal crew.  The car's front tyre suddenly became punctured.  The driver was trying to control the unbalanced car from hitting an oncoming truck.  As a result the car rolled over 4 times and landed at the road side.  The car was badly damaged.

A Rigger was transferring a scaffolding board for storage in the metal basket. While he was about to put the board into the basket, he lost his balance and fell, resulting in the board which he was handling hitting his right middle finger. He sustained bone fracture to his middle finger.

Contractor was standing on a ladder making the top bunk.   He was leaning over the guard rail to reach across the bunk to tuck in the opposite side of the bed.  The guard rail broke causing the contractor to fall off the ladder onto the floor resulting in three days restricted work duty.

This accident occurred during a taking away derrick activities.  The truck driver was caught between two buoys used to do this operation.  This accident was caused by the truck driver's imprudence when he tried to pass between the two low buoys.  Also the working procedure was inadequate.

A contractor was crushed between cargo items when unloading whilst positioning cables to make lifting safer. The victim suffered a fractured leg and muscle and soft tissue injuries.  Likely causes: inadequate work planning, workplace layout, lack of proper cargo restraints for conditions.

Accidental emission: 1100 litres of hydraulic oil. After a shut down, production was restarted again. It was discovered that the consumption of hydraulic oil was increasing. They started trouble shooting and found that a valve was not closed. An ROV and an intervention vessel are mobilized

Two men where changing a light bulb on the P-4031 panel in the MCC room. One man was thrown backwards by an explosion when he opened the panel door. He received 2nd degree burns to his hands, thighs, chest and face. The other man received flash burns to his back. (lwd 60 days and 30 days).

Two operators, a man and a woman, were injured during transfer of corrosion inhibitor through a 10 mm instrument pipeline from one tank to another. When a valve was opened, a calibration glass exploded due to overpressure and both operators were exposed to the chemical and glass fragments.

While the Crane Crew was lifting the Riser Running tool from the Port Riser Deck, the Riser Running Tool came in contact with the tip of a Riser Station post. This resulted in the lift cap failing and the Riser Running Tool weighing 5,182 lbs. to drop approximately 45•À_ to the Riser Deck.

Approximately 2200 hours on Thursday, 31st March 1994, Captain William Gardner in the process of crossing between the Mac Tide 66 and his vessel, Mac Tide 48, fell into the water and subsequently drowned.  His body was retrieved shortly after and efforts were made to revive him to no avail.

During dismantling of scaffolding, the victim stepped from the platform structure to the scaffolding and fell into the sea.  The victim was secured by a lifeline to the scaffolding but this part also fell into the sea.  Despite immediate rescue attempts, victim could not be recovered alive.

A short Circuit Flash incident took place on 3.3KV switchboard-6A, inside a substation due to Flash over.  Three Personnel suffered partial burn injuries (2nd and 3rd degree burns) while carrying out the routine maintenance on a switchgear (Motor starter for the Propane Loading Pump Motor).

A total of 15 passenger and a driver were on their way back to Base Camp. The truck was ascending uphill (approx. 40 degree), when it suddenly stopped just before the top. The driver failed to control the brake which resulted in the vehicle skidding backwards very fast and hitting the slope.

Due to a shut down of the main power the waterproof doors closed. One person tried to open this door manually. When he was passing through he dropped the handle and the door began to close and crushed the person in his chest.  He was sent onshore and returned to work after medical treatment.

In severe weather conditions, the rig West Stadril was struck by a large wave.  The wave broke over main deck displacing containers and equipment.  The deceased who was on the deck at the time was crushed under a container and was pronounced dead some twenty minutes after arrival at sick bay.

When pulling a 3 1/2" pipeline from the stacking rack, the Driller applied the brake system, which was set to one position below normal. The pipeline slipped away downwards. The Driller pulled the emergency brake, which did not work; then he applied the hydromatic system with negative result.

Straight road of 5 km from A1 Bsera/ Damascus Palmayra eight meters wide and a banquet of two meters on both sides.  Smash trace of ten meters by the left front and back wheels on the main road.  Sight clear.  Car completely smashed.  Dead body on the right side of the driver with safety belt.

Piercing of condensate pipeline by bulldozer during seismic operations. During the construction of the ramp, the pipeline was punctured by a bulldozer, resulting in a significant release of pressurized condensate and consequential loss of production by the owners and operators of the pipeline.

The injured person grabbed the hinge of a door when another person was closing it and his 5th finger became caught.  He had grabbed the door hinge to keep his balance when removing his survival suit after a helicopter journey. The severity of the wound led to the finger having to be amputated.

The plant annual shut down was being completed. A pipeline PV had been removed for calibration and not replaced yet. Gas was introduced to the pipeline from the wellsite and leaked from the open flange of the removed PV. Leak pressure around 350psi for a short period. No injuries, no ignition.

A fire was observed near the vent line of dry/wet oil tank on platform. ESD system was activated to cut off well fluid inflow to the facility. At the same time the gas inventory was blown down and AFFF extinguishing system was activated inside the dry oil tank to prevent any further escalation.

During mini-turnaround of gas plant, there were 2 valves which were not de-isolated, resulting in 2 incidents where the process system was over pressured, causing gasket failures and consequent hydrocarbon releases.  The second resulted in 6 tonnes of LPG enveloping the plant as a vapour cloud.

At approximately 10:20hrs on October 21st 2009, while transferring a high pressure water pump, from the western side of the separator deck  to the supply vessel, the pump came in contact with a railing. This caused it to become dislodged and fall into the sea. No one was hurt during the incident.

A piect of ire-fighting equipment fell down from helideck and onto the underlying deck. The equipment had been left behind after maintenance had been carried out and blew down when the helicopter came in. There were a lof of people waiting for the helicopter. The equipment fell down near a person.

At 04:11 the Driller, after completing well killing, opened the BOP rams and stated packer pull-out, when a sudden weight surge to 75 tons occurred, resulting in the crippling of UPA-60 WO unit upper derrick section and its collapse to the derrick floor. No one was hurt. The well was not damaged.

The well built up excessive wellhead pressure. Surface equipment failed to contain the pressure due to the use of inappropriate completion brine, inappropriate well control equipment system and inappropriate well control practices. A blow-out resulted which was brought under control after 4 weeks.

The "Mansel-32", a BSP chartered workboat, returned to Maura supply base for essential maintenance. In the early afternoon the deceased and other personnel went on shore returning at about 21:30. After boarding the Mansel-32, the deceased was seen in the water. Artificial respiration was attempted.

A contractor was collecting cuttings samples from the shale shakers. He proceeded to walk down the stairway from the shakers carrying three sample bags. While approaching the bottom of the stairs he fell, landing on the ground. He sustained a head injury and loss of consciousness for a brief period.

While collecting an oil sample the oil in the metal bucket caught fire.  The operator suffered a minor burn to his right index finger. The fire was attributed to static electricity and was extinguished immediately using a DCP portable fire extinguisher. There was no asset, plant, or equipment damage.

Condition of landing site caused helicopter to hover for disembarkation. Last passenger off gave pilot the thumbs-up to depart then tried to retrieve bag from helicopter landing skid as aircraft lifted. Pilot was unaware of situation. Passenger lost his grip after 3 km of flight and fell to his death.

A victim was involved in the crane lifting operation of the mud pump from a truck. Due to miss communication between the crane operator and the signal man, the pump was loaded onto the victim's right foot and broke his toe. He was transferred to hospital and was given 21 days off from his normal duty.

Due to the clearing of a safety valve on an oil manifold the drain went to open drain. After a short time the gas detector was triggered.  7-8 gas detectora were triggered and they recorded >20%LEL i two modules. Automatic shutdown of production and the personnel mustering according to safety plan.

The deceased was standing with his colleagues at the roadside having a conversation. A 3d party, driving a defective vehicle and under the influence of alcohol, crashed into the men. The deceased received head injuries and died shortly after being admitted to the hospital which was only 75 metres away.

The Assistant Driller was replacing inserts on hydraulic tongs GKSH-1200 to make connections on tubing. When he started up the hydraulic tongues his arm got squeezed in the rotating device and a half of his right forearm was amputated (heavy injury) as a result at the level of one third of his forearm.

Two radiography technicians were riding in a pickup when the bonnet cover of the pickup opened and the driver could not control the steering wheel. The windscreen broke and the pickup turned over four times. One man was badly injured and died in hospital 2 hours later the other man was slightly injured.

A worker fell approximately 11 metres from an electrical pole when he failed to resecure his safety harness after repositioning for a work assignment.  Although experienced in task assignment the worker was not a full time employee of the contractor and this was his first day of work for several months.

A crew boat collided with a mooring boat near the pier. The crew boat hull plates ruptured in several places & water gushed into the compartments. All the crew members were evacuated before the boat sank into the sea. However with the help of divers the crew boat was floated back up with in 48 hours.

An operator received 2nd and 3rd degree burns to his hand, arm and face while attempted to light a production unit burner.  The operator was utilizing a make-shift torch consisting of an ether-soaked rag on the end of a piece of stainless steel tubing.  Weather conditions at the time were windy and cold.

The Gathering Centre (GC) Tripped on level-2 Emergency Plant Shutdown due to a malfunction in the Tank Vapour flare monitoring system(Therocouples). All crude manifold's shutdown valves and export valves were closed abruptly, subsequently major crude leaked from different locations at pipeline's flanges.

While working on the drilling tool, the lock for the Shepard's Hook broke and fell, hitting the derrick, glancing off and then hitting the injured person on the head as he stood inside the doorway of the dog house. The injured person's hard hat was broken, but the impact was great enough to cut his head.

While transfering a load with a pedistal crane from the production deck to the top deck, the hose union caught on the edge of the deck that caused the hanging rope to be severed. The rope and load was released and fell to the sea. As the rope was falling it hit a person beside his right eye causing a cut.

A new section of seismic streamer had been spooled onto the workboat winch. When disconnecting the hydraulic hoses, the Junior Positioning Specialist recieved an electric shock. An earth fault was found on the workboat's electric heater. It was also found that the workboat was not fitted with earth wiring.

On 18th June 2005, at about 12.05 hours, a Super Puma AS332L1 helicopter, operated under long term charter to the operating company, encountered technical difficulties and made an emergency landing in the sea approximately 7nm from the gas platform. The helicopter turned over soon after hitting the water.

The team leader suffered a fatal accident when 3 workers were assisting in the preparations on the ROW for laying a new flowline to a well. They were erecting warning poles/flags next to a live (34.5KV) overhead power line when one of the poles came into contact with the line, electrocuting the team leader.

During the maintenance of a 36" pipe line, the line was partially drained. A employee opened the drain valve and found no flow. He then tried to flush/clean the elbow just to make sure that nothing was inside the pipe. Al of a sudden a strong flow came out from the elbow and caused an overflow of Crude Oil.

The operator was struck by a pipeline section, which broke off from an oil well multiple used in well draining activities. The pipeline got loosened from the multiple together with a 0 2" flow valve. The valve did not resist the high pressure operation because it was inadequate for such operating conditions.

A contract grader operator went behind a running water tanker truck to relieve himself.  The truck driver, unaware of the operator's presence, backed over the victim.  The operator was hospitalized with a pulmonary contusion, fractured ribs, and undetermined intra-abdominal injury and a fractured left femor.

A contractor crew was performing handling operations using a Ural 4320 truck-mounted crane at pad, when, at 11:30, the crane's front left outrigger collapsed as the load was being lowered to the rack. As a result, the crane tilted to the left with the extension boom running into the ground. No one was hurt.

A worker manually lifted a joint pipe (10•À_ length and 30kg weight) while rigging up line on rig floor. The IP complained of pains on the lumbar region. The Doctor on-site recommended Medevac and a further exploration at hospital revealed the need of surgery intervention to recover from damage on the backbone.

During circulating the driller was picking the topdrive up when the brake released causing the topdrive to drop, uncontrolled, for approximately 8 metres until the pipe handler came to rest on the rotary table. The travelling block was hanging loose over the side of the topdrive when everything came to rest.

Fracture and leakage were discovered in a welded joint in forward and abaft bracing, respectively 70 mm and 50 mm. Observation of the fractures is continuing. The well is to be secured and the rig taken to land for inspection and repair. Personnel are being sent to land gradually as the activity is phased out.

At 05:00 a.m. a bus transporting contractor's personnel  from town to work place collided frontally with a pick up of other contractor company. The pick up crossed lane causing the accident. As result 14 people were injured. Both land and air evacuation were performed. One person injured was classified as LWDC.

The injured person was found on the deck next to the tank container. Apparently the injured person had climbed the tank to check the fluid level inside by lifting the lid. His injuries indicated that he had fallen off the tank, a height of approx. 2.2m. He was working alone at the time, there were no witnesses.

During installation of Halon 1301 cylinder, repetitive movement during alignment caused the securing pin to be dislodged, resulting in accidental Halon release. The three workers who were inside the room during Halon release were able to avoid personal injury by immediate evacuation and closing of the room doors.

A contractor crew was performing work on the well. At 14:16, after completing reaming at a depth of 3049 meters, the drilling line broke in the drawworks drum 3 meters from the rotary table during lifting to make a connection. The swivel fell to the rotary table. No one was hurt. There was no damage to equipment.

Drilling an oil well, a hopper truck was parked in front of the rig in order to discharge arite to the rig. When the hopper was being pressurised, the operator climbed onto the truck to fit the tank cap, due to an air release. Suddenly the hopper cap was shot up by the pressure accumulated in the tank, striking him.

Whilst jacking up a barge's legs to move off location, one of the legs ruptured the barge's ballast tank. The accident was attributed to mechanical and instrumentation failure of the leg operating devices. This resulted in a breach to the ballast tank and impact damage to the lower guides in the subject leg housing.

During the offloading of the Vessel, the support vessel for the well Coiled Tubing activity came along side the platform and its stern came into contact with the platform boat landing structure. There was no visible damage, neither on the Platform nor from the Boat side. The impact location is the East side platform.

The injured person slipped and fell from the slippery pipe (covered with oil) into an evaporation pond while attempting to push the rubber boom out of the outlet pipe. He received burns to his arms and legs from the high temperature of oil / water fluid. He was treated at hospital and was given 11 days off from work.

A Boeing 737 chartered aircraft from the Peruvian Airforce crashed 5 km short of Andoas Airport.  The aircraft was carrying personnel to the field.  A total of 79 passengers and 8 crew members were on board.  There were 13 survivors.  59 contractor person, 6 company personnel and 9 Third Party individuals were killed.

During a simultaneous operation (rig dismantling after W.O. and valve control fo the well head under pressure) the foreman ordered the travelling block to go down. This struck a valve fitted with a nipple. The nipple broke and the valve blew. The victim received the blast and was thrown against a cabin 12 metres away.

Mr. Burke (welder) was installing a kick plate near mud pump No.1 when Sedco driller engaged both mud pumps.  Pumps started simultaneously against the closed internal bop valve.  Hydraulic surge opened the 2 pop off valves, one body and vertical pipe failed by high pressure, this assembly struck Mr. Burke on his head.

While pulling tubing from a well during P&A, a lifting sling assembly was being used that included a shackle with a smooth bolt held in place by a cotter pin.  When lifting assembly was pulled across guide roller on the derrick structure, the cotter pin sheared and a joint of pipe fell on a member of the rig crew.

A driver was driving Karosa bus, in conditions of poor visibility (darkness hour, wet snow).  On the 28th km of road he lost control of the bus.  The bust caught snow on the safety zone by its left-side wheel, started skidding,  turned about, got to the right road side and then to the road ditch where it rolled over.

A hydraulic jack, weighing 7 kgs, was being used to align a 46 inch flange. The jack was resting on cribbing. As the jack was being extended it slipped from its position and dropped approximately 24 metres coming to rest on a structure about 4 metres above ground level. The area below the work site was not barricaded.

A water truck was driven and parked underneath an overhead power line.  The truck driver stepped out of the cab and stood on the top of the tank.  The distance from his head and the power line was only about one meter.  His helper was standing on the ground near the truck.  Both were electrocuted and sent to hospital.

An operator heard a noise from the gearbox, went to investigate and dropped a spanner inside the barrier zone. When he tried to get the spanner back he was struck by the rotating lever arm on the right side by the downward stroke. Multiple fractures of pelvis, pubic bone and hip, lacerated bladder, internal bleeding.

While the Rig Mechanic was removing tools from a steel locker the entire locker tilted towards him.  He stepped back to try and get clear of the falling locker but his left foot was caught between the top edge of the locker and the floor.  This resulted in swelling and multiple fractures of the bones in his left foot.

The activity was to take the hoses from the Shakers and Sacks store area and store them in the Metal Box Container on the main deck. The IP was caught between the cover lid and the edge of the box suffering First Aid injuries. The IP put himself with his upper half of the body inside the box and the other half outside.

Whilst cutting down trees damaged in earlier storms, a contract logger from a service company was injured in the left leg by the chain saw he was using, despite wearing protective leg equipment.  The injury was diagnosed as minor and stitched.  He is wearing a plaster cast to aid walking and has resumed restricted work.

A mechanic climbed on the anchor winch frame support to check the winch and tighten the brake. While tightening the brake, the anchor wire drum rotated backward due to barge movement. The injured person's left foot was caught between the supporting frame and the winch drum resulting in a crush injury with 3 broken bones.

A fire occurred in an installation, sub main enclosure during an investigation of spurious generator heat detection trips. The Power Technician at the scene manually shut down the generator and manually activated the enclosure's FWSS.  The Emergency Response team extinguished the fire. There were no injuries to personnel.

On 15th April 2011 in the OAG plant area and during the lifting of a motor shaft of the Air Compressor, the overhead monorail axe snapped and the lifting chain block fell to the ground slightly injuring the right hand fingers of the vendor representative. Medical treatment was immediately provided to the injured employee.

Drill crew was in the process of positioning the well head protector frame on the production platform over the wellhead. The port side conductor guide was lifted and fell approximately 30 feet to the platform deck. The approximate weight of the guide is 500 lbs. The area was clear of personnel at the time of the operation.

A blow out occured in a drilling rig due to the accidental entry of a fluid influx into the well and incorrect TIW safety valve cross over on the rig floor (unmatched work string). The well was killed and secured within 3 hours 30 minutes. However there was no loss of life or injury to personnel, no damages to the property.

While setting a patch at the fourth running tool in the hole with the cable line tension about 2000-2200 lb the winch cable unit slid to the adjacent logging cabin. At the same time a man was walking into the logging cabin. The man was hit by the winch cable sheave and sustained an injury to his lower knee on his right leg.

A rig was in the process of rigging down wireline operations in the forward derrick and preparing to pick up drill collars in the aft derrick. The idle Pipe Racking Sytem (PRS) in the aft derrick experienced main shaft failures at the bottom and top, allowing the top of the PRS to fall across the derrick.  No one was struck.

A vehicle carrying a contractor recording front crew to the acquisition site was travelling up the gradient, suddenly the vehicle stalled, immediately free wheeling back down the slope for 40m and then rolled on its side before coming to the stop. The victim suffered a head injury, arm fracture, leg fracture and neck injury.

During off-duty hours (and therefore not 'reportable' under OGP definitions) a contractor at a remote field road construction site camp fell into an open cooking fire and received serious burns and scalding from the large pot of boiling water located on the fire (31% burns).  He died as a result of his injuries 7 days later.

On 28th May, at approximately 14:00 Hrs, while an assistant driller was reciprocating the drill string, the drill string, Kelly and travelling blocks began to rapidly descend. The Kelly landed out in the bushing with the travelling block lying on top of the Kelly and against the derrick substructure. No persons were injured.

The Spear Assembly came lose from the BX elevator from a vertical position when placed on the drill floor for disconnection. The Spear Assembly, approximately 8 m and 2.7 tonnes, fell from a vertical position to the drillfloor towards the catwalk. A person was hit on the lower legs by the Spear Assembly when it hit the deck.

Four drums on a wooden pallet were being lifted at the platform when the wooden pallet and metal banding straps failed, causing the four drums to fall.  Two drums were lost to the sea and sank immediately and the other two fell to the south west stairway of the platform, damaging the stairway.  Luckily there were no injuries.

On July 2, the bellows upstream a LCV of an oily water treatment unit, ruptured. Fortunately, one operator saw the water jet, alerted the Control Room and asked for activation of ESD1. The panel operator initiated the ESD1. The H2S detectors, all set at 50ppm, were triggered, including those in the Control Room located nearby.

The injured person was holding a std of drill pipe with a rope in his right hand at the end of the board ready to throw into the elevators as the block was traveling up.  A NNW wind was causing the block and elevators to swing. The horn of the elevators hit the contractors right hand, pinching it between the std of drill pipe.

Trackhoe was digging bell holes for tie-ins to existing pipelines. The operator hit and ruptured a 6 inch fiberglass natural gas pipeline with 150 psi of pressure. The contractor had violated permit and policy by allowing mechanized digging within a specific distance of a loaded line. Potential existed for explosion and burns.

When the victim was detatching the mooring line of a construction barge, the mssgr line of the mooring line became entangled on the forward port side bollard. The vicitim proceeded to clear the mssgr line at the bollard entanglement, but it cleared itself. Suddenly the towline tension struck the victim's right leg and he fell.

The accident occurred at 5.30 am. A truck/trailer transporting 11 pieces of 18•À_•À_ pipe for unknown reasons continued straight on a slight curve point and went off the road. The overturned cab of the truck was severely damaged and the driver sustained fatal injuries. His helper survived the crash with shoulder and chest injuries.

A concrete mixer came into contact with a live 11KVA line.  At that time the Safety officer had left his place without a replacement and the company representative also had left the area. The mixer driver did not notice the overhead hazard and struck the live O/H lines, 11KVA, with the top of its equipment. No injures to report.

A carpenter was replacing a roof at the camp church, using PPE. While he was working his roof his mallet fell down to the ceiling. He tried to reach it by releasing his safety belt hook. He then stepped down to the ceiling and fell to the floor. He suffered a fracture on his left thigh and was taken directly to Emergency Medical.

During implementation of works associated with cross-cutting of fallen wood a cross-cutter of a seismic exploration (born in 1971) was injured by a falling tree. The casualty was transported to an injury care center in Turtas settlement. The preliminary diagnosis: open fracture of shin-bone in the bottom third of the right shank.

A truck loaded with gravel took a bend, the truck missed the road and ended up on its side. The driver sustained bruising to his left shoulder, knee and forehead and small wounds to his hand. Investigation revealed several areas for action to prevent recurrence. These have been included in journey management and work instructions.

A pick up vehicle with 2 passengers was driving from the construction site.  As the driver approached a bend in the road he lost control, the vehicle skidded, left the road and overturned. The vehicle was fitted with rollover protection. The driver and front seat passenger were wearing seat belts, whilst the rear passenger was not.

During a move of a drilling rig between locations in Rajasthan, the kelly hose attached to the rig mast came into contact with a live overhead power line carrying 11,000 volts. This caused heavy arching and lead to smouldering of tyres. The driver of the prime mover and 2 persons riding with the rig mast did not sustain any injury.

Two oilfield operators checked the performance of an oil counter. Employers dissembled the counter then put it together and started regular work. The counter worked normally for a few minutes but suddenly exploded. One operator jumped out of the room, the second operator suffered a head injury from the pieces of the broken counter.

•À_•À_ A platform experienced a process shutdown due to a loss of all generators while switching power loads. The platform shut in as designed. During the shutdown, the high pressure compressor package suffered a gas leak which resulted in a fire inside the turbine gas compressor enclosure. There were no injuries and no oil was released.

The IP was trying to perform personnel transfer to an installation barge from a tug boat by jumping towards the monkey ladder at the barge when suddenly his left leg was caught in between the boat landing pole and the tug boat fender. He was the first person to jump out of 4 personnel to the transfer boat to connect the mooring line.

A gas release incident took place on the gas production platform (PP) on 21st August 2006 at about 10:05 am where grit blasting had begun for a few minutes in close vicinity. The gas release was due to the break of glass at LG3343 •À__ level sight glass of 2nd stage scrubber of 2nd compression train where 50barg gas was passing through.

A stand of 10 inch drill collar was being racked at the racking board when the stand went past the point of balance and slid to the back of the racking board, between the diving board and racking board fingers.The injured party was struck by the drill collar on the left side of his chest/shoulder area, causing fracture to collar bone.

Proppant and sand had been allowed to collect in a test separator. During a well clean up a gas blowby occurred as the liquuid low level swith had been inhibited on a previous job and forgotten. Proppant and sand entrained in the gas flow eroded a hole in downstream pipework. 2.6T of hydrocarbons released over 20 minutes. No ignition.

The victim was involved in the crane lifting operation of damaged casing (10-3/4") from pipe rack to the ground. When the load was  1.5m off the ground, one of the slings slid out of the auxiliary hook safety pin and dropped onto the victim's left leg and crushed it.  The victim was transferred to hospital where his leg was amputated.

A leaking suction valve on a compressor was being replaced when a spark ignited gas coming out of the flange as the new valve was being bolted into place.  Nine workers were burned and 7 required hospitalization. This incident demonstrates the need to follow change management procedures and to avoid shortcuts to operational procedures.

While going to load a 4" pipe joint, from a tool box to the rig floor, the assistant driller was riding on the left side of the forklift and a roustabout was on the right side. On their way to the box, suddenly the roustabout fell down on the ground and complained of pain to his back. He was moved to the hospital for further treatment.

During rig up operation employee fell from cca. 8 m height. The incident happened when they were working on the last pair of clamps. During this operation employee fell down onto 9 •À__•À_•À_ drill collar elevator on rig floor. He was transferred to hospital by helicopter. (Workers were provided with all necessary PPE as per risk assessment.)

Gas kick during a mud dilution operation, due to misunderstanding between mud engineer, mud loggers and driller. Gas was trapped below stuck pipe, and when pipe was freed, gas came to surface in a few seconds pushing out 46m3 mud before closing rams. Master bushing was pushed out 1 meter from rotary table. No personal injuries occurred.

Four drums on a wooden pallet were being lifted at the Platform in Indonesia when the wooden pallet and metal banding straps failed, causing the four drums to fall.  Two drums were lost to the sea and sank immediately and the other two fell to the south west stairway of the platform, damaging the stairway.  Luckily there were no injuries.

A hydrocarbon fire incident occurred at a produced water skimmer pit. A leaking valve created an abnormal accumulation of condensate in the surface water handling system. While transferring water, condensate was also transferred to the pit. A condensate slug generated a static discharge at the pipe outlet igniting the condensate in the pit.

During the transfer of wireline equipment from the boat to the platform, the hydraulic fitting on the crane failed, causing hydraulic pressure loss.  The crane ram closed in and the boom came down with a load of about 3.6 tonnes.  Due to the weight suspended, the crane boom kinked and bent towards the sea suspending the load over the water.

A group of workers were conducting a wire rope change on a 15 MT platform deck crane. While hoisting and retrieving wire, the seizing wire of size 28mm in diameter slipped from wire tuck and fell on the deck. The wire rope hit a Bosun who was working underneath the wire tuck. He suffered bruises at his head, left mid-forearm and right elbow.

After working at 140ft depth, the diver was proceeding to the surface with a stop at 40ft for 5min. After 2min the diver encountered difficulties. A 2nd diver was sent out and found the diver 10ft away from his line. The victim was helped to the surface and admitted to the diving chamber. 25min later the pulse of the victim became unpalpable.

A helicopter was in the process of landing on a drill rig, when a large container housing a personnel transfer basket and weighing more than 200kg, was lifted by the airflow from the helicopter's rotor. The container passed over a handrail and fell approximately 10m to the deck below.  Nobody was hurt and the container sustained minor damage.

Contract electrician's helper got his right hand crushed and lacerated when the air compressor he was working on unexpectedly started.  The worker was immediately taken to a nearby hospital and then transferred to another hospital where surgery was performed to graft his index finger tip and remove tips of two middle fingers to first knuckle.

The injured person thought that the flame on a flare was extinguished during a flow back following a frac treatment.  He climbed the berm to check on the flare pilot and was near the top when a slug hit the flare.  Apparently the pilot was lit as the flames due to the slug resulted in the injured person sustaining burns to his arms and hands.

While lowering an FRC for a pipeline inspection job the FRC snagged against the ship's side and capsized. Three persons were thrown into the water, another three persons managed to stay in the FRC. Basic risk factor:  Procedures (Inadequate knowledge of procedures for correct lowering of FRC into water when using it for operational purposes).

While manually aligning the Casing Filling Tube (CFT) to put it in the 7" casing and proceed with the elevator change (pickup elevator for side door elevator), the hanging end of the CFT hit the 7" coupling casing border averting the trajectory of the CFT and hitting the derrick man on his chest, pushing him back and injuring his left thigh.

At 14:00 h, the Corrosion Departmet personnel went into the exhaust ducting of a gas turbine to make an internal check. While they were doing the inspection work, at 15:30h, the turbine air compressor was started to wash with a high crank. Nobody told to the Technical Inspection and Corrosion personnel, who were inside the turbine, to get out.

During pressure testing of a coiled tubing BOP, a 3/4" plug in equalising valve broke free. As a projectile, the plug first directly hit a stand of heavy walled drill pipe on the pipe rack and was then deflected to strike a glancing blow on the driller•À_s head behind his left ear. The driller suffered a minor laceration on the back of the ear.

At 12:20 disconnection of lines from an oil switch at a substation resulted in a short circuit which caused an electrical injury to an electrical mechanic. The casualty was transported by an ambulance to the central regional hospital. The preliminary diagnosis: electrical point burns of fingers on the right hand. His condition is satisfactory.

While performing maintenance activity to carry out servicing of a Genie Man Rider, the mechanic, who is a contractor employee was standing on the tyres of the Genie. While stepping down he lost his balance and could not control himself. As a result he fell and twisted his left ankle. The injured person was given first aid and taken to hospital.

While working with a Coiled Tubing Cable Injector Head, one of the deck personel was injured. The crane operator misunderstood the deck operator and he performed a lift when the deck operator was standing on the equipment. The strap dropped and all the equipment and the deck operator fell down on deck. The deck operator suffered chest injuries.
